protruding through the upper layers of r: protruding through the upper layers of rocks.$(br2)With all that in mind, the next few pages list the rocks of all four categories: $(thing)Sedimentary$(), $(thing)Metamorphic$(), $(thing)Igneous Extrusive$(), and $(thing)Igneous Intrusive$(). There are seasons, and the weather and c: 群峦传说的世界是有四季的，气象和气候也会随之变化。每个季节根据月份分为$(thing)初期$()、$(thing)仲期$()和$(thing)暮期$()。以下是四季所对应的月份：$(br)$(li)$(bold)春季$()：三月 - 五月$(li)$(bold)夏季$()：六月 - 八月$(li)$(bold)秋季$()：九月 - 十一月$(li)$(bold)冬季$()：十二月 - 次年二月
The current season can influence the tem: 当前季节会影响地区的温度和降水（如果可以下雨或下雪）等。所以一定要经常查看日历，它对你的生存会有很大的帮助！$(br2)接下来，我们来谈谈气候。
Another tab on the main inventory screen: 物品栏界面中的另一个选项卡是$(thing)气候$()界面。这个页面会显示有关当前地理位置的信息。$(br2)第一行会显示该地区的$(l:https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9F%AF%E6%9C%AC%E6%B0%94%E5%80%99%E5%88%86%E7%B1%BB%E6%B3%95)气候分类$()。$(br2)第二行会显示$(l:the_world/geology)地质结构$()。$(br2)第三行则会显示$(thing)年平均温度$()。
Temperature in TerraFirmaCraft is influe: 一个地区的温度是由几个因素共同决定的。$(br)$(li)首先，地质结构和纬度（Z 坐标）的影响是最大的。$(li)其次是当前的季节——夏天最热，冬天最冷。$(li)最后，每天的不同时间温度也会有所不同，且天和天之间也会有小幅变动。
The last line shows the current temperat: 最后一行显示的是当前由上述因素共同决定后的温度。$(br2)温度会影响很多事情：作物和植物是否会生长，冰雪是否会形成或融化等等。
Rainfall is another climate value that c: 降雨量是一个会根据地理位置而变化的数值。年降雨量以毫米（mm）为单位，可以在 0mm - 500mm 之间取值。地表土壤是沙子还是淤泥，植被是仙人掌还是木棉树都由降雨量决定。
Rainfall is also important as it affects: 一个区域的降雨量还决定了何种农作物能被种植在这儿。降雨量的多少是影响土地$(l:mechanics/hydration)湿润度$()的一个重要因素，而湿润度则决定了$(l:mechanics/crops)农作物$()、$(l:the_world/wild_fruits#fruit_trees)果树$()、和$(l:the_world/wild_fruits#tall_bushes)灌木丛$()是否可以生长。

The firepit can be extinguished at any t: 篝火可以随时通过手持$(thing)铲子$()点击来熄灭。$(br2)可以将一些其他物品放置在篝火之上来改变其功能。放置$(thing)锻铁烤架$()可将篝火变成$(l:mechanics/grill)烧烤架$()，可一次加热五个物品。放置$(thing)陶锅$()则会将篝火变成$(l:mechanics/pot)大锅$()，可用来煲汤。要移除篝火上的额外设备，可以按住$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()并按下$(item)$(k:key.use)$()。千万注意不要移除还未冷却的烤架和锅！
A firepit, with either a grill or pot ad: 一个篝火，添加了烤架或锅。

$(thing)Clay$() is an incredibly useful: $(thing)粘土$()是一种特别有用的材料，你可以用它制作陶器。一开始你可能难以找到粘土，因为它们总是隐藏在草皮之下。但简而言之，有两种获取它们的手段。首先，粘土会在$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)年降雨量$()大于 175mm 的区域中成片地大量生成，而且有几种特殊的$(thing)植物$()会生长在粘土之上。
Clay, with one of the plants that may in: 粘土草方块，其上生长的是粘土指示植物。
$(thing)Athyrium Fern$(), $(thing)Canna$: 有几种植物指示了附近可能存在粘土，它们是：$(thing)蹄盖蕨$()、$(thing)美人蕉$()、$(thing)一枝黄花$()、$(thing)蒲苇$()、$(thing)分药花$()、和$(thing)水生美人蕉$()。其次，粘土也会在水源附近，比如河流、湖泊、或水池边，以小块的形式生成。$(br2)和石子类似，粘土也可以被塑形成有用的物品。需要手持五个粘土球才能塑形。不同于石子塑形，捏坏了的粘土并不会消失，只要关闭粘土塑形界面重新尝试即可。

A $(thing)Hammer$() is an essential tool: $(thing)锤$()是在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上制作物品不可或缺的工具。
A $(thing)Knife$() can be used as a weap: $(thing)刀$()可以当作武器使用，不过主要还是用来破坏植物类型的方块。
A $(thing)Hoe$() used for planting and m: $(thing)锄$()可以用来种植和管理$(l:mechanics/crops)农作物$()。

In addition to sticks, twigs, and stones: 除了地上的那些木棍、树枝和小石子，你可能还遇到过散落在地表的小矿粒。多收集一点吧，在你获得镐之前，这是你获得矿石和金属为数不多的方法之一。

Using $(thing)Daub on $(thing)Woven Watt: 对准$(thing)编织加固过的板条$()使用$(thing)涂料$()就能将其转变为实心方块。

Clay obtained from the ground can be cra: 粘土球可以做成粘土块。将粘土块放在地上再挖掉就可以把它变回粘土球。虽然谈不上美观，它们至少很好获得。$(br2)泥炭也是一种不受重力影响的方块，常常会在水边生成。有些植物也会生长在泥炭上。$(br2)然而，泥炭很容易着火。
Just kidding! The $(thing)Thatch Bed$(): 游戏早期你可以做一张$(thing)干草床$()。虽然不能用它来跳过夜晚，但至少可以用来设置你的复活点。要搭建干草床，在地上放置两个相邻的$(thing)干草块$()，然后手持一张$(thing)大块兽皮$()右击干草块。只有大型动物会掉落大块兽皮，例如$(thing)熊$()和$(thing)牛$()。
Every item has a $(thing)Size ⇲$() and $: 每种物品都有其$(thing)体积 ⇲ $()和$(thing)重量 ⚖$() 。物品的体积和重量会显示在其$(thing)工具提示$()中，将鼠标悬停在物品上就能查看。
Size determines what storage blocks an i: 物品的体积决定了何种容器可以装得下这种物品。$(br)$(li)$(thing)极小$()的物品可以装在任何容器里。$(li)$(thing)非常小$()的物品可以装在任何容器里。$(li)只有$(thing)小$()及以下的物品可以装在$(l:mechanics/decay#small_vessels)小缸$()里。$(li)只有$(thing)普通$()及以下的物品可以装在$(l:mechanics/decay#small_vessels)大缸$()里。
$(li)$(thing)Large$() items are the larg: $(li)只有$(thing)大$()及以下的物品可以装在箱子里。$(li)$(thing)非常大$()的物品只能单独在$(l:getting_started/pit_kiln)坑窑$()中烧制。$(li)$(thing)极大$()的物品不能装进任何普通容器中，而且携带它们会导致你负担过重。
Weight determines the max stack size of: 物品的重量决定了它一组可堆叠的上限。$(br)$(li)$(thing)非常轻$()：64$(li)$(thing)轻$()：32$(li)$(thing)中等$()：16$(li)$(thing)重$()：4$(li)$(thing)非常重$()：1$(br2)大部分物品都属于$(thing)非常轻$()的类别。方块一般都是$(thing)中等$()重量。
$(thing)Overburdening$() happens when yo: 物品栏中存在$(thing)极大$()且$(thing)非常重$()的物品会使你$(thing)负担过重$()。只要携带一件$(thing)极大、非常重$()的物品就会导致你变得疲惫，饥饿值也会消耗得更快。携带两件以上就会使你进入$(thing)负担过重$()状态，行动也会变得极其缓慢。
Items that count towards overburdening i: 会导致负担过重的物品有$(thing)砧$()、$(thing)密封的大桶$()、装有物品的$(thing)坩埚等。$()$(br2)提示: $(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#horses)马$()也会负担过重。
In TerraFirmaCraft, not only must you ma: 在群峦传说中，你不仅需要注意你的饥饿度，还需要管理你的口渴度。饥饿度的机制和原版类似。大部分的食物会为你回复五分之一饥饿条，其他一些食物（比如$(thing)香蒲根$()）则会少回复些。进食还会使你回复一些$(thing)饱和度$()，也就是饱腹感。
Some foods are very filling, so they kee: 几乎任何动作都会消耗饥饿度。疾跑、游泳、或$(l:getting_started/size_and_weight#overburdening)负担过重$()都会更快消耗饥饿度。有关某样食物可以为你回复的$(thing)饱和度$()、$(thing)口渴度$()、和$(thing)营养元素$()可以通过在物品栏中将鼠标放置在其上并按住$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()检视。
All foods have a tooltip with this infor: 所有食物都可以用这种方法展开详细的工具提示。食物的$(l:mechanics/decay)保质期$()也会在此显示。需要注意的是，不是所有能吃的东西都有营养价值。比如$(l:mechanics/bread)面团$()可以吃，但毫无营养，而且也不会回复饱和度或口渴度。这样的食物吃了也没多少好处。
A food tooltip may look like:$(br2)$(bol: 以下是一个食物的工具提示的示例：$(br2)橙子$(br)$(2)保质期：1004年 七月6日 11:59（约1月1天）$()$(br)营养：$(br)- 饱和度：2%$(br)- 口渴值：2%$(br)$(a)- 水果：0.5
The nutrition screen, with bars showing: 这是营养界面。每个状态条显示了你目前的营养水平。
There are five nutrients, all obtainable: 群峦传说中有五种营养元素。它们都可以通过吃东西摄入：$(l)$(a)水果$()$()、$(l)$(2)蔬菜$()$()、$(l)$(c)蛋白质$()$()、$(l)$(6)谷物$()$()、和$(l)$(5)乳制品$()$()。保持每种营养元素都处于较高水平会增加你的最大生命值，反之则会降低生命值。食用食物就能摄入它所蕴含的营养元素。通过制作$(l:mechanics/pot#soup)汤$()之类的$(thing)餐点$()可以将多种食材组合成为一顿食物。$(thing)用餐$()比分开吃烹饪材料更好，因为你的营养元素水平是根据你吃的最后几个食物决定的。
$(l)$(a)Fruit$()$(): Fruit nutrients are: $(l)$(a)水果$()$()：水果元素的主要来源于$(l:the_world/wild_fruits)果木$()。比如灌木和果树。两个值得注意的特例是$(l:mechanics/crops#pumpkin)南瓜$()和$(l:mechanics/crops#pumpkin)西瓜$()。这两种植物也被算作是水果。$(br2)$(l)$(2)蔬菜$()$()：大部分$(l:mechanics/crops)农作物$()都蕴含这种营养元素。$(br2)$(l)$(c)蛋白质$()$()：$(l:the_world/wild_animals)动物$()肉都含有蛋白质。对于不想杀生的玩家来说，一个肉食的替代品则是$(l:mechanics/crops#soybean)大豆$()。大豆同时拥有蛋白质和蔬菜元素。
$(l)$(6)Grain$()$(): Grain is found in g: $(l)$(6)谷物$()$()：谷物元素是由……呃，谷物提供的。比如$(l:mechanics/crops#barley)大麦$()。如何将谷物变成有用的食物主要写在$(l:mechanics/bread)烤面包$()章节。$(thing)香蒲根$()和$(thing)芋头根$()也算谷物。$(br2)$(l)$(5)乳制品$()$()：所有乳制品都是用$(thing)奶$()制成的。想要获得奶，就必须繁殖$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#dairy_animals)产奶动物$()。如何将生奶变成有用的食物主要写在$(l:mechanics/dairy)乳制品$()章节。$(br2)食物一旦腐败便完全不能吃了。关于防止食物腐败的知识，请阅读$(l:mechanics/decay)食物保鲜$()章节。
Thirst is the level of water in your bod: 口渴度指的是你身体中的水分含量。口渴度和饥饿度一样会缓慢流失。处于高温环境，或进行剧烈运动都会使口渴度流失得更快。用$(item)$(k:key.use)$()点击$(thing)淡水$()水源方块就可以回复你的口渴度，但要注意喝咸水反而会导致你损失更多口渴度，有时你还会获得会让你持续流失更多口渴度的$(thing)干渴$()状态效果。
To avoid saltwater, look for rivers, lak: 河流和湖泊中的水往往都是淡水。另外，$(thing)阔叶香蒲$()之类的植物只会生长在淡水中。
$(l:getting_started/pottery)Knapping$(): 将粘土$(l:getting_started/pottery)塑形$()并烧制成一只$(l:getting_started/pottery#jug)罐$()便能将水带在身边了。手持空罐用$(item)$(k:key.use)$()点击水源就能盛水。按住$(item)$(k:key.use)$()便能从中喝水。
Depleting food or water completely resul: 当你的饥饿度或口渴度太低时，你的移动和挖掘速度都会变得很缓慢，还会不断受到伤害。你的营养元素会在死亡后重置。

$(thing)Aqueducts$() are a tool used for: $(thing)引水桥$()是一种可以将$(thing)水$()从水源引至其他地方的建筑方块。$(l:mechanics/wooden_buckets)木桶$()无法搬运水源，但$(thing)引水桥$()可以将水源方块运往水平方向任意距离外的目的地。它可以运输任何类型的水，包括$(thing)淡水$()、$(thing)咸水$()、$()温泉水$()。
A singe aqueduct block can be crafted wi: 可以用$(l:mechanics/advanced_building_materials#bricks_and_mortar)石砖和砂浆$()制作引水桥方块。
In order to use an $(thing)Aqueduct$(),: 把$(thing)引水桥$()方块水平连接起来，然后将一端连接到相邻$(thing)水源$()或$(thing)下落的水流$()侧面，稍等片刻，水就会开始流经这个引水桥网络，并且在引水桥的另一端流出。$(br2)如果引水桥被破坏了，水流就会中断。同时，$(thing)引水桥$()不会产生永久的水源方块 - 引水桥破坏之后所有水都会消失。
$(thing)Livestock$() are animals that ca: $(thing)牲畜$()是可以被玩家驯服和饲养的动物。牲畜可以是$(thing)公的$()或$(thing)母的$()。某些动物会有$(thing)两性异形$()的现象。例如，只有公猪会有獠牙。
Livestock experience $(thing)aging$(). T: 牲畜会逐渐$(thing)衰老$()。刚出生的幼崽不会产出资源，也不能繁殖。一段时间之后它们才会$(thing)成年$()。成年的牲畜可以提供蛋、奶等资源，也可以繁殖出新的幼崽。当繁殖或产出资源多次之后，牲畜有可能会衰老。衰老的动物只能作为肉用。
This bull is old and cannot breed, so it: 这只牛太老了，不能繁殖。可以从它灰白的毛色和模糊的眼睛中看出。
Livestock can be fed to raise $(thing)fa: 喂养牲畜可以提升与之的$(thing)亲密度$()。每种动物都有其喜爱的食物。手持食物对准牲畜按住$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()的同时按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就可以喂养了。
Livestock have a $(thing)Familiarity Ind: 按住$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()并看着牲畜时会在头上显示其$(thing)亲密度$()。
Familiarity decays a little each day if: 如果不喂食，亲密度每天都会减少一点。但如果亲密度高到一定程度（出现一个白色轮廓的心），亲密度就不会因此减少了。
Adult livestock cannot be fully familiar: 成年牲畜无法达到 100% 的亲密度（出现红色轮廓的心），只有幼年牲畜可能达到 100% 的亲密度。
$(thing)Mammals$() are livestock that ex: $(thing)哺乳动物$()是通过怀孕繁殖的牲畜。喂食一对亲密度超过 30% 的成年哺乳动物就会让它们开始……你懂的。之后雌性动物将会$(thing)怀孕$()。怀孕的动物会在几个月至一年之内产子。$(br)比如，$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#pig)猪$()就是哺乳动物。
$(thing)Wooly Animals$() are $(l:mechani: $(thing)产毛动物$()是$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#mammals)哺乳动物$()的一种。如果它们和你的亲密度足够高且已成年就可以$(thing)剪毛$()。$(br)$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#sheep)绵羊$()、$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#alpaca)羊驼$()和$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#musk_ox)麝牛$()都属于这一类动物。
$(thing)Dairy Animals$() are mammals tha: $(thing)产奶动物$()也是哺乳动物的一种。只要成年且亲密度足够，就可以用木桶点击雌性产奶动物来挤奶。$(br)$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#goat)山羊$()、$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#cow)奶牛$()和$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#yak)牦牛$()都属于这一类动物。
$(thing)Oviparous Animals$() are not $(l: $(thing)卵生动物$()不像$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#mammals)哺乳动物$()可以直接产下幼崽，而是通过产下并孵化$(thing)蛋$()来繁殖。它们只能在$(thing)巢箱$()中产卵。$(br)$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#duck)鸭子$()、$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#quail)鹌鹑$()和$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#chicken)鸡$()都属于这一类动物。
$(thing)Eggs$() can be cooked or boiled: $(thing)蛋$()可以煎来吃或煮来吃。雄性动物可以让雌性受精，使其产下的下一枚卵变为受精卵。受精卵会在其工具提示里显示它们还需要多久才能孵化。
$(thing)Equines$() are $(l:mechanics/ani: $(thing)骑乘动物$()是$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#mammals)哺乳动物$()的一种，可以在亲密度到达 15% 之后骑乘。
They need a $(thing)Saddle$() to ride, w: They need a $(thing)Saddle$() to ride, which can be $(thing)Knapped$(). This includes $(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#mule)Mules$(), $(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#donkey)Donkeys$(), and $(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#horses)Horses$(). Mules and Donkeys can hold any chest or barrel. If holding a barrel, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() while holding $(item)$(k:key.sneak)$() can be used to remove it. The same keys while holding a bucket can be used to drain fluid from the barrel. $(br2)The next few pages will go over all livestock types.
$(thing)Pigs$() spawn in mild forests wi: $(thing)猪$()会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在 -10 到 35°C 之间、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()至少 200 毫米的温和森林中生成。它们是没有特殊功能的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#mammals)哺乳动物$()。它们会吃任何食物（可以是腐烂的）。它们一胎能生产 1-10 个幼崽，怀孕 19 天，80 天成年。衰老前它们可以产仔 6 次。
$(thing)Cows$() spawn in most climates,: $(thing)牛$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在 -10 和 35°C 之间、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()至少 250 毫米的大多数气候中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#dairy_animals)产奶动物$()。它们只吃$(thing)谷物$()（可以是腐烂的）。他们一胎能生产 1-2 个幼崽，怀孕 58 天，192 天成年。若从未挤过奶，衰老前它们可以产仔 13 次。若从未产过仔，衰老前它们可以挤奶 128 次，且每天都可挤奶。
$(thing)Goats$() spawn in moderate clima: $(thing)山羊$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在 -12 到 25°C 之间、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()至少 300 毫米的温和的气候中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#dairy_animals)产奶动物$()。它们会吃$(thing)谷物$()、$(thing)水果$()和$(thing)蔬菜$()（可以是腐烂的）。他们一胎能生产 1-2 个幼崽，怀孕 32 天，96 天成年。若从未挤过奶，衰老前它们可以产仔 6 次。若从未产过仔，衰老前它们可以挤奶 60 次，且每三天可挤一次奶。
$(thing)Yaks$() spawn in cold climates,: $(thing)牦牛$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()不超过 -11°C、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()至少 100 毫米的寒冷的气候中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#dairy_animals)产奶动物$()。它们只吃新鲜的$(thing)谷物$()。它们一胎只能产 1 个幼崽，怀孕 64 天，180 天成年。若从未挤过奶，衰老前它们可以产仔 23 次。若从未产过仔，衰老前它们可以挤奶 230 次，且每天都可挤奶。
$(thing)Alpacas$() spawn in moderate cli: $(thing)羊驼$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在 -8 到 20°C 之间、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()至少 250 毫米的温和的气候中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#wooly_animals)产毛动物$()。它们会吃$(thing)谷物$()和$(thing)水果$()。他们一胎能生产 1-2 个幼崽，怀孕 36 天，98 天成年。若从未剪过毛，衰老前它们可以产仔 13 次。若从未产过仔，衰老前它们可以剪毛 180 次，且每 6 天长出一次羊毛。
$(thing)Sheep$() spawn in drier climates: $(thing)绵羊$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在 0 到 35°C 之间、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$() 70 到 300 毫米的较干燥的气候中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#wooly_animals)产毛动物$()。它们会吃$(thing)谷物$()。它们一胎能生产 1-2 个幼崽，怀孕 32 天，56 天成年。若从未剪过毛，衰老前它们可以产仔 6 次。若从未产过仔，衰老前它们可以剪毛 60 次，且每 9 天长出一次羊毛。
$(thing)Musk Oxen$() spawn in cold clima: $(thing)Musk Oxen$() spawn in cold climates, with $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() between -25 and 0°C, and at least 100mm of $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$(). They are $(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#wooly_animals)Wooly Animals$(). They eat $(thing)grains$(). They always have 1 child, are pregnant for 64 days, and reach adulthood in 168 days. $(thing)Chickens$() spawn in warm forest: $(thing)鸡$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()不低于 14°C、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()至少 225 毫米的温暖的森林中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#oviparous_animals)卵生动物$()。它们会吃$(thing)谷物$()、$(thing)水果$()、$(thing)蔬菜$()和$(thing)种子$()（可以是腐烂的）。每 30 小时产一次卵，8 天孵化，24 天成年。衰老前可以产卵 100 次。
$(thing)Ducks$() spawn in most plains, w: $(thing)鸭$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在 -25 到 30°C、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()至少 100 毫米的大多数平原中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#oviparous_animals)卵生动物$()。它们会吃$(thing)谷物$()、$(thing)水果$()、$(thing)蔬菜$()和$(thing)种子$()（可以是腐烂的）。每 32 小时产一次卵，8 天孵化，32 天成年。衰老前可以产卵 72 次。
$(thing)Quails$() spawn in colder climat: $(thing)鹌鹑$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在 -15 到 15°C、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()至少 200 毫米的较冷的气候中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#oviparous_animals)卵生动物$()。它们会吃$(thing)谷物$()、$(thing)水果$()、$(thing)蔬菜$()和$(thing)种子$()（可以是腐烂的）。每 28 小时产一次卵，8 天孵化， 22 天成年。衰老前可以产卵 48 次。
$(thing)Donkeys$() spawn in wetter plain: $(thing)驴$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在至少 -15°C、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$() 130 到 400mm 的潮湿的平原中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#horses)骑乘动物$()。可以在它们身上放置一个$(thing)箱子$()。它们会吃$(thing)谷物$()和$(thing)水果$()。它们一胎只能产 1 个幼崽，怀孕 19 天，80 天成年。衰老前它们可以产仔 6 次。
$(thing)Mules$() spawn in plains with $(: $(thing)骡子$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在至少 -15°C、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()在 130 到 400mm 的平原中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#horses)骑乘动物$()。可以在它们身上放置一个$(thing)箱子$()。它们是$(thing)马$()和$(thing)驴$()杂交的产物，只有雄性，无法繁殖。他们吃$(thing)谷物$()和$(thing)水果$()。80 天成年。
$(thing)Horses$() spawn in plains with $: $(thing)马$()是一种会在$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)温度$()在至少 -15°C、$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()在 130 到 400 毫米的平原中生成的$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#horses)骑乘动物$()。它们会吃$(thing)谷物$()和$(thing)水果$()。它们一胎只能产 1 个幼崽，怀孕 19 天，80 天成年。衰老前它们可以产仔 6 次。
$(thing)Pets$() are animals that functio: $(thing)宠物$()是一种与$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry)牲畜$()行为类似的动物。它们不会产出资源，但会听从玩家的指令、跟随玩家、并且帮你做捕猎和捕杀害虫等事情。
Pets recognize a certain player as their: Pets recognize a certain player as their $(thing)Owner$(). To become a pet's owner, feed it to raise its familiarity above 15%%. Pets will only obey commands that come from their owner.$(br2)Clicking on a pet with $(l:mechanics/dye)dye$() changes its collar color.
Dogs are a pet that eats grains, vegetab: 狗是一种喜欢吃谷物、蔬菜和肉类（无论是否腐败）的宠物。它会帮助你狩猎大多数的陆地捕食者或猎物。
Cats are a pet that eats grains, cooked: 猫是一种喜欢吃谷物、熟肉以及乳制品的宠物。它们会帮助你狩猎陆地猎物和小型鱼类。在家里的时候，猫会自行捕杀害虫，不需要命令。当被要求坐下的时候，猫可能不总是会听话。
Responsible pet owners must learn to con: 负责任的宠物主人需要学习如何管理自己的宠物。好在这并不是件难事。在空手的状态下按住$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()并按下$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就可以打开$(thing)宠物面板$()。这个面板包含了一系列可以命令宠物做的事情，例如$(thing)休息$()、$(thing)我们到家了$()、$(thing)坐下$()、$(thing)跟着我$()、以及$(thing)跟我打猎$()。
$(thing)Relax$() is the default state of: $(thing)休息$()是宠物的默认状态，点击这个命令就能让宠物回到这个状态。在休息状态下，在家里的宠物会绕着家闲逛，但是不会跑远，并且会每天睡一次觉。如果宠物离家很远，它就会毫无目的的闲逛。
$(thing)We're Home$() sets the home posi: $(thing)我们到家了$()会设置这个宠物的“家”的位置。这样就可以告诉宠物，在休息的时候呆在这附近，不要跑太远。这个命令不会改变宠物现在正在做的事情。$(br2)$(thing)坐下$()会命令宠物原地坐下。然而宠物会有自己的想法，坐久了感觉无聊，就会自己站起来溜达！
$(thing)Hunt With Me$() tells the pet to: $(thing)跟我打猎$()会告诉宠物跟着你，并且在你发动攻击或被攻击的时候参加战斗。宠物只会攻击他们力所能及的敌人（例如, 猫肯定不会帮你猎杀熊！）。$(br2)$(thing)跟着我$()和“跟我打猎”类似，不同之处在于宠物不会冒险加入你的战斗。
$(thing)Leather$() is a sturdy material: $(thing)皮革$()是一种由兽皮制成的结实耐用的材料。它可以用来制作$(thing)皮革盔甲$()、$(thing)鞍$()、以及$(l:mechanics/bellows)风箱$()。$()兽皮$()必须经过一系列复杂的工序之后才能变成$(thing)皮革$()。首先是$(l:mechanics/leather_making#soaking)浸灰$()，然后是$(l:mechanics/leather_making#scraping)剖层$()，接着要$(l:mechanics/leather_making#preparing)脱灰$()，最后还要$(l:mechanics/leather_making#tanning)浸酸$()。
To get started you will first need to ob: 制皮的第一步自然是得先找到$(thing)兽皮$()。世界各地的$(l:the_world/wild_animals)野生动物$()都会掉落兽皮。不同的动物掉落的兽皮大小会有所不同。
Leather making will require several mate: 制皮还需要几件其他工具：$(br)$(li)一大桶$(l:mechanics/barrels#limewater)石灰水$() - 将$(l:mechanics/flux)助焊剂$()在大桶中溶于$(thing)淡水$()就能得到了。$(li)一大桶淡水。$(li)一大桶$(l:mechanics/barrels#tannin)鞣酸$() - 这是一种用某些树的树皮制成的酸液。$(li)一把$(thing)小刀$()。$(br2)有了这些工具，你就可以准备开始制皮了！
First, raw hides must be $(thing)soaked$: 第一步是$(thing)浸灰$()。这一步是用来清洗并软化兽皮上的杂质的。将$(thing)兽皮$()密封浸泡在装有$(l:mechanics/barrels#limewater)石灰水$()的大桶中 8 个小时即可。
After soaking, $(thing)Soaked Hides$() m: $(thing)浸泡$()好了的皮革还需要剖层，以此来移除皮革上残留的杂质。将一根原木横放在地上，然后再将皮革放置在原木上方。接着手持$(thing)小刀$()对准皮革的每一个部分按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()。已经刮好了的部分会改变其外观。
Once the hide is fully scraped, it can b: 皮革完全刮干净之后就可以将其从原木上取下了。你应该会得到一块$(thing)刮制皮革$()。
After scraping, $(thing)Scraped Hides$(): $(thing)刮制皮革$()还需要在装有淡水的$(l:mechanics/barrels)大桶$()里密封至少 8 小时。这是在$(thing)鞣制$()前的最后一步清理步骤。
Finally, $(thing)Prepared Hides$() must: 最后，将脱完灰的$(thing)预制皮革$()封入装有$(l:mechanics/barrels#tannin)鞣酸$()的大桶中，等待 8 个小时。待鞣酸反应完全之后就能从桶中获得$(thing)皮革$()啦！
$(thing)Weaving$() is the process of com: $(thing)织布术$()是一种将线变为$(thing)布匹$()的工艺。虽然将线织成布只需要$(thing)织机$()就行了，但想要将$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#wooly_animals)产毛动物的$()$(thing)毛$()捻成$(thing)羊毛纱$()线就得先做一只$(thing)纺锤$()。
The $(thing)Unfired Spindle Head$() is k: $(thing)纺锤头$()可以通过粘土塑形来制作。先将粘土如图捏成$(thing)未烧制的纺锤头$()$，然后在将其$(l:mechanics/heating)加热$()即可。将纺锤头与$(thing)木棍$()合成便能做出纺锤了
Crafting $(thing)Wool$() with a Spindle: 将$(thing)羊毛$()与纺锤合成，得到$(thing)羊毛纱$()。
The loom is crafted from just $(thing)Lu: 可以用$(thing)木材$()和$(thing)木棍$()制作织机。
The recipe for $(thing)Wool Cloth$() tak: 每 16 卷$(thing)羊毛纱$()能够织成一匹$(thing)羊毛布$()。首先，手持羊毛纱对准织机按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()。接着持续$(item)$(k:key.use)$()点击织机。待织机处理完整匹毛布后再次按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就可以取下布匹了。
织机织布的几个不同阶段。
$(thing)Wool Cloth$() can be re-woven in: $(thing)Wool Cloth$() can be re-woven into $(thing)Wool Blocks$(). Wool blocks can be $(l:mechanics/dye)dyed$().
$(thing)Silk Cloth$() can be made in the: 织机可以将$(thing)蛛丝$()织成$(thing)丝绸$()。丝绸在某些配方中可以代替羊毛布。
$(thing)Burlap Cloth$() does not have a: $(l:mechanics/crops#jute)黄麻纤维$()可以织成$(thing)粗麻布$()，但现在看来它还是没有什么用的样子。
$(thing)Paper$() is either made from the: $(thing)Paper$() is either made from the processed stalk of the $(l:mechanics/crops#papyrus)Papyrus$() crop, or from $(l:mechanics/papermaking#parchment)Animal Hides$(). Paper is useful for written materials like $(thing)Books$() and $(thing)Maps$().
Papyrus must first be cut into strips wi: Papyrus must first be cut into strips with a $(thing)Knife$()
Then, papyrus strips are soaked in a $(l: Then, papyrus strips are soaked in a $(l:mechanics/barrels)Barrel$() of $(thing)Water$().
Then, soaked papyrus strips are woven to: Then, soaked papyrus strips are woven together in a loom to make $(thing)Unrefined Paper$(). Finally, it must be placed on a log and $(l:mechanics/leather_making#scraping)Scraped$() to make $(thing)Paper$().
Flip to the next page for information on: Flip to the next page for information on papermaking via the parchment process.
$(thing)Parchment Paper$() starts with a: $(thing)Parchment Paper$() starts with a scraped hide. Review the $(l:mechanics/leather_making)leather making chapter$() to learn how to make it. Parchment requires treatment with a few different items. First, $(thing)Pumice$() is needed. Pumice is found on the ground near $(l:the_world/geology)Volcanoes$(), or from $(l:mechanics/sluices)Sluicing$() or $(l:mechanics/panning)Panning$() ore deposits with Andesite, Rhyolite, or Dacite in them.

Crafting pumice, a hammer, and scraped h: Crafting pumice, a hammer, and scraped hide gives sections of $(thing)Treated Hide$().
Treated hide, $(l:mechanics/glassworking: Treated hide, $(l:mechanics/glassworking#lime)lime powder$(), flour, and a fresh egg will complete the treatment process and yield usable paper.
Glassworking is the process of turning s: Glassworking is the process of turning sand into glass. To start, you must create a $(thing)Glass Batch$(), of which there are four types:$(br)$(br) 1. $(thing)Silica$(), from white sand.$(br) 2. $(thing)Hematitic$(), from yellow, red, or pink sand.$(br) 3. $(thing)Olivine$(), from green or brown sand.$(br) 4. $(thing)Volcanic$(), from black sand.
Glass batches can then be crafted using: Glass batches can then be crafted using one of the aforementioned colors of sand, plus $(l:mechanics/glassworking#lime)Lime$() and a type of $(l:mechanics/glassworking#potash)Potash$().
$(thing)Lime$() is one of the ingredient: $(thing)Lime$() is one of the ingredients required to make glass batches. It is a powder obtained by $(l:mechanics/heating)heating$() $(l:mechanics/flux)Flux$().
A type of $(thing)Potash$() or equivalen: A type of $(thing)Potash$() or equivalent is also required for glass batches. $(thing)Soda Ash$() can be used, which is a powder made from heating $(thing)Dried Seaweed$() or $(thing)Kelp$(). $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#saltpeter)Saltpeter$() can be used as well.
Glassworking is done by starting with a: Glassworking is done by starting with a glass batch, and then completing a series of steps. These steps may require specific tools:$(br)$(li)A $(l:mechanics/glassworking#blowpipe)Blowpipe$(), to $(thing)Blow$() and $(thing)Stretch$()$(li)A $(l:mechanics/glassworking#paddle)Paddle$(), to $(thing)Flatten$()$(li)$(l:mechanics/glassworking#jacks)Jacks$(), to $(thing)Pinch$()$(li)A $(l:mechanics/glassworking#saw)Gem Saw$(), to $(thing)Saw$()
The most important tool is the $(thing)B: The most important tool is the $(thing)Blowpipe$(). It can be $(thing)knapped$() from clay, and then fired into a $(thing)Ceramic Blowpipe$().
Ceramic blowpipes are brittle, and have: Ceramic blowpipes are brittle, and have a chance to to break when used. A more sturdy blowpipe can be $(l:mechanics/anvils#working)worked$() from a $(thing)Brass Rod$() on an anvil.
The $(thing)Flatten$() operation can be: The $(thing)Flatten$() operation can be done with a $(thing)Paddle$(), which is crafted from wood.
The $(thing)Pinch$() operation can be do: The $(thing)Pinch$() operation can be done with $(thing)Jacks$(), made from welding two brass rods together.
The $(thing)Saw$() operation can be done: The $(thing)Saw$() operation can be done with a $(thing)Gem Saw$(). The gem saw is also used to break both $(thing)Glass Blocks$() and $(thing)Glass Panes$() and obtain them.
First, glass on the blowpipe must be hea: First, glass on the blowpipe must be heated to $(4)$(bold)Faint Red$().Then, hold the blowpipe and hold $(item)$(k:key.use)$() to perform each step$().$(br2)$(bold)Blow$()$(br)Use the $(thing)Blowpipe$() while facing straight ahead.$(br2)$(bold)Stretch$()$(br)Use the $(thing)Blowpipe$() while facing straight down.
$(bold)Flatten$()$(br)Use the $(thing)Bl: $(bold)Flatten$()$(br)Use the $(thing)Blowpipe$() while holding a $(l:mechanics/glassworking#paddle)Paddle$() in your offhand.$(br2)$(bold)Pinch$()$(br)Use the $(thing)Blowpipe$() while holding $(l:mechanics/glassworking#jacks)Jacks$() in your offhand.$(br2)$(bold)Saw$()$(br)Use the $(thing)Blowpipe$() while holding a $(l:mechanics/glassworking#saw)Gem Saw$() in your offhand.$(br2)$(bold)Roll$()$(br)Use the $(thing)Blowpipe$() with a $(l:mechanics/weaving#wool_cloth)Wool Cloth$() in your offhand.
The most simple glass products are $(thi: The most simple glass products are $(thing)Glass Panes$() and $(thing)Glass Blocks$(). In order to craft them, you must start with a $(l:mechanics/glassworking#blowpipe)Blowpipe$() with a $(thing)Glass Batch$(), and then perform a $(thing)Pour$().$(br)$(li)$(bold)Table Pours$() are used to create $(thing)Glass Panes$()$(li)$(bold)Basin Pours$() are used to create $(thing)Glass Blocks$()
Glass can also be $(thing)dyed$() before: Glass can also be $(thing)dyed$() before it is poured to create colored glass. The color is dependent on the type of glass batch, and any powders that have been added.$(br2)Each type of $(thing)Glass Batch$() has a different natural color of glass that they will create. $(thing)Silica$() glass batches can be made into many colors, $(thing)Olivine$(), and $(thing)Volcanic$() glass can be made into relatively few colors.
$(thing)Glass Panes$() are made with a $: $(thing)Glass Panes$() are made with a $(thing)Table Pour$(). A pouring table is made by placing up to sixteen $(thing)Brass Plated Blocks$() in a continuous area.$(br2) 1. Add a $(l:mechanics/glassworking)Glass Batch$() to a $(thing)Blowpipe$().$(br) 2. Finally $(item)$(k:key.use)$() with a $(l:mechanics/glassworking#paddle)Paddle$() to flatten the glass.
Once the glass is cooled, it can be brok: Once the glass is cooled, it can be broken with a $(l:mechanics/glassworking#saw)Gem Saw$() to obtain.
$(thing)Glass Blocks$() are made with a: $(thing)Glass Blocks$() are made with a $(thing)Basin Pour$(). A basin is made by surrounding all sides of an air block except the top with $(thing)Brass Plated Blocks$().$(br2) 1. Add a $(l:mechanics/glassworking)Glass Batch$() to a $(thing)Blowpipe$().$(br) 2. Heat the blowpipe to $(4)$(bold)Faint Red$().$(br) 3. $(item)$(k:key.use)$() the $(thing)Blowpipe$() on the top of the table.
Glass has a natural color based on the t: Glass has a natural color based on the type of $(l:mechanics/glassworking)Glass Batch$() that was used. Other colors can be made using a $(l:mechanics/bowls)Bowl$().$(br2)To use, place the $(l:mechanics/bowls)Bowl$() on the ground, then $(item)$(k:key.use)$() the required $(thing)Powder$(). Before $(thing)Pouring$(), use the $(thing)Blowpipe$() on the bowl to add the powder to the batch.

The availability of glass colors. 'C' is: The availability of glass colors. 'C' is clear, 'T' is tinted. Colors can only be crafted with certain glass batches.
$(thing)Lamp Glass$() is a necessary com: $(thing)Lamp Glass$() is a necessary component to craft $(l:mechanics/lamps)Lamps$().
$(l:mechanics/jarring)Jars$() are also m: $(l:mechanics/jarring)Jars$() are also made from blown glass, but only silica or hematitic glass.
$(thing)Glass Bottles$() can also be mad: $(thing)Glass Bottles$() can also be made. The quality of the glass bottle depends on the type of glass used to make it.
The $(thing)Lens$() is used for crafting: The $(thing)Lens$() is used for crafting the spyglass, compasses, and daylight sensors.
$(thing)Bowls$() are a versatile tool wh: $(thing)Bowls$() are a versatile tool which can be used to make $(l:mechanics/salad)Salads$(), to make $(l:mechanics/pot)Soups$(), to $(l:mechanics/decay#salting)Salt$() meat, or to apply $(thing)Powder$() to $(l:mechanics/glassworking_applications#coloring)Glass$() in order to change the resulting glass's color.$(br2)Bowls can be made both from $(thing)Ceramic$(), by knapping a bowl out of clay, and then firing them.
Multiple unfired bowls can be made from: Multiple unfired bowls can be made from one knapping.
Bowls can also be made out of wood via c: Bowls can also be made out of wood via crafting them together with $(thing)Glue$()$(br2)$(thing)Glue$() can be made by soaking $(thing)Bone Meal$() in a barrel of $(l:mechanics/barrels#limewater)Limewater$().
Bowls can also be placed on the ground l: Bowls can also be placed on the ground like blocks. When placed, they can be filled with any type of $(thing)Powder$() - the results of grinding ores, minerals, or gems in the $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$().
The Powder Bowl can hold up to 16 of a g: The Powder Bowl can hold up to 16 of a given powder. To insert items, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() while holding the powder. To extract items, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() with an empty hand.$(br2)$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$() allows extracting the entire contents of the bowl.
If there is salt in the bowl, clicking w: If there is salt in the bowl, clicking with unsalted raw meat will salt the meat. This is the same as crafting the meat with the salt in your inventory.
$(thing)Jars$() are used to preserve fru: $(thing)Jars$() are used to preserve fruit for longer periods of time. Jars start as $(thing)Empty Jars$(), obtained through $(l:mechanics/glassworking_applications#jar)Glassworking$(). Then, a $(thing)Jar Lid$() must be smithed from $(thing)Tin$(). Crafting these together creates an $(thing)Empty Jar With Lid$().
In a pot, boil $(thing)Sugar$() with 2-4: In a pot, boil $(thing)Sugar$() with 2-4 pieces of $(thing)Fruit$(). When the recipe is done, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() with the empty jar with lid to create a $(thing)Sealed Jar of Jam$(). The sealed jar will last quite a long time on its own.
Unsealing a jar is done by crafting. The: Unsealing a jar is done by crafting. The lid is not able to be retrieved. An unsealed jar only lasts for a few days!
Jam is used for making sandwiches. Jam s: Jam is used for making sandwiches. Jam sandwiches can contain Dairy, Cooked Meats, and Jam. An $(thing)Empty Jar$() is left over.
Jars can be placed on solid surfaces wit: Jars can be placed on solid surfaces with $(item)$(k:key.use)$(). A block can contain four jars of any kind.
$(thing)Jar Shelves$() can be attached t: $(thing)Jar Shelves$() can be attached to solid walls. They can be placed directly or by clicking on an existing block of placed jars. The top of the jar shelf counts as a solid surface for placing items, more jars, or other blocks.
Bread is the processed form of the vario: $(l:mechanics/crops#barley)大麦$()之类的农作物只会产出未加工的稻谷。直接收获的谷物并没有什么营养价值，但若能把它们做成$(thing)面包$()就好吃多了。面包还能做成$(l:mechanics/sandwiches)三明治$()。
First, cut the straw off of the food wit: 首先，先用$(thing)小刀$()将麦粒从秸秆上刮下来。
Grains are the longest-lasting stage of: 麦粒是谷物处理过程中保存时间最长的形式，长达 10 个月零 7 天。若放在小缸之类的容器中，则可以储存长达 1 年零 9 个月零 7 天。
Grain must then be ground in a $(l:mecha: 接下来，将麦粒放在$(l:mechanics/quern)手推磨$()上磨成面粉。
Dough is crafted by adding a bucket of $: 将面粉和一桶$(thing)淡水$()合成成面团。
Dough is then able to be $(l:mechanics/h: 最后，只要将面团$(l:mechanics/heating)加热$()就可以烤出面包。面包可以做成$(l:mechanics/sandwiches)三明治$()。
$(thing)Sandwiches$() are a meal allowin: 制作$(thing)三明治$()能将最多三种$(thing)蔬菜$()、$(thing)熟肉$()、或$(l:mechanics/dairy)奶酪$()，和两片$(l:mechanics/bread)面包$()组合成一顿$(thing)餐点$()。
The sandwich recipe, which is executed i: 在$(thing)工作台$()上合成三明治。
The nutrients, water, and saturation of: 做出来的三明治会结合所用食材以及面包所提供的营养元素、水分、和饱和度。三明治会包含面包 50% 的营养和其他食材 80% 的营养。制作三明治所用的食材不能腐败。三明治本身的保质期和所用食材剩余的保质期无关。
$(thing)Dairy$() is a $(l:getting_starte: $(thing)乳制品$()是一种主要由$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#dairy_animals)产奶动物$()提供的$(l:getting_started/food_and_water#nutrients)营养元素$()。可以直接用陶罐喝奶，会回复$(l:the_world/food_and_water#thirst)口渴度$()，也可以将奶做成$(thing)奶酪$()。需要注意的是，空腹喝奶并不能摄入多少营养元素，只有在吃过其他食物之后再喝奶才能吸收营养。换句话说，连续多次喝奶的效率比吃一顿饭、喝一口奶的效率要差。
To start the $(thing)Cheesemaking$() pro: 想要制作$(thing)奶酪$()，第一步是将$(thing)奶$()和$(thing)醋$()以 9 比 1 的比例在$(l:mechanics/barrels)大桶$()里混合。最简单的方法是先往桶里倒 9 桶奶，然后再倒 1 桶醋。这样就能得到$(thing)醋奶$()。
Once milk and vinegar are mixed, it will: 将醋奶混合之后密封大桶，奶就会开始逐渐凝固成炼乳，只需静待 8 小时即可。
Cheese is then made by once again sealin: 制成炼乳之后先不要开盖，继续静置 8 小时就能将炼乳凝固成奶酪了。奶酪是一种保质期很长的乳制品，且可以作为某些餐点（比如$(l:mechanics/sandwiches)三明治$()）的食材以提供乳制品营养元素。
The $(thing)Scribing Table$() is used to: $(thing)命名台$()是用来给物品重命名的。重命名需要消耗$(thing)黑色染料$()。可以直接用染料物品，也可以用一桶黑色染液代替。
The scribing screen takes text entry at: 在命名台的上方输入文字，将要重命名的物品放在左侧，中间放置染料。右侧的格子就会输出物品。
The $(thing)Sewing Table$() is used to p: The $(thing)Sewing Table$() is used to produce banner patterns and smithing templates. It requires $(l:mechanics/weaving#wool_cloth)Wool Cloth$(), $(l:mechanics/weaving#burlap_cloth)Burlap Cloth$(), String or Yarn, as well as a Needle.
A needle for sewing can be made from a b: A needle for sewing can be made from a bone.
The sewing table can be made from wood,: The sewing table can be made from wood, leather, and a pair of shears.
The sewing table's inventory is similar: The sewing table's inventory is similar to that of a crafting table. If you ever make a mistake, you can simply exit the inventory, and your items will be returned to you. There is a recipe book available in the GUI. Selecting the book opens a menu where you can select a recipe. This places small indicators of what steps to perform on the working surface.
The slots on the left are for the string: The slots on the left are for the string and the needle. The two bottom slots can hold any combination of burlap and wool cloth. The slot on the right will show the result when it is ready to be taken. Taking the result from the result slot completes the craft, and uses the items.
Each cloth item allows placing 8 squares: Each cloth item allows placing 8 squares of that material on the sewing surface. Similarly, each yarn item allows placing 16 stitches. When you have selected a recipe, just use the buttons on the top right of the screen to place squares and stitch them together as shown by the guide. Want to remove stitches? Use the red 'X' button to get rid of squares.
The banner loom, for making things with: The banner loom, for making things with banner patterns, can be crafted to do work with banner patterns.
For information on the use of smithing t: For information on the use of smithing templates, see the $(l:mechanics/armor_trims)Armor Trims$() chapter.
Armor trims are produced with a $(thing): Armor trims are produced with a $(thing)Trim Material$() and a $(l:mechanics/sewing_table)Smithing Template$(). In TFC, all gems, along with Sterling Silver, Gold, Rose Gold, and Bismuth, can be used as trim materials. Armor trims are purely cosmetic.
The smithing table can be used to apply: The smithing table can be used to apply armor trims to TFC armor.
In addition to the primitive $(l:getting: 除了石器时代的基础$(l:getting_started/building_materials)建筑材料$()，金属工具可以帮你生产更多的高级建筑材料
Alabaster is a building block made from: 雪花石膏是一种用$(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#gypsum)石膏$()矿做成的建筑材料。石膏可以直接在物品栏中做成雪花石膏，不过等以后有了$(l:mechanics/barrels)桶$()会有更高效的制作方法。
Alabaster can be $(l:mechanics/dye)dyed$: Alabaster can be $(l:mechanics/dye)dyed$() in a $(l:mechanics/barrels)Barrel$() of dye into any color. Raw Alabaster blocks can also be $(l:mechanics/chisel)chiseled$() into $(thing)Polished Alabaster$() using the $(thing)Smooth$() chisel mode, or crafted into stairs, slabs, or walls.
$(thing)Stone Bricks$() can be made usin: 将一些小石子与$(l:mechanics/chisel)凿子$()在合成栏中合成就可以得到这种岩石的$(thing)砖$()。将砖与$(thing)砂浆$()合成就能做成坚固的建筑方块。$(br2)砂浆可以通过将$(thing)沙子$()加入装有$(l:mechanics/barrels#limewater)石灰水$()的大桶得到。
Other decorative stone blocks can also b: 你还可以制作其他的石头装饰方块，例如$(thing)裂纹砖$()和$(thing)雕刻过的石砖$()。将圆石或石砖方块放在水下的其他苔石旁，苔藓就会扩散，将其转换为$(thing)苔石$()或苔石砖。
$(thing)Salads$() are a meal prepared in: $(thing)Salads$() are a meal prepared in a $(thing)Bowl$() from up to five $(thing)Fruits$(), $(thing)Vegetables$(), or $(thing)Cooked Meats$().$(br2)Salads are one of the simplest meals to make, and just require a $(l:mechanics/bowls)Bowl$(). First, hold the $(thing)Bowl$() and press $(item)$(k:key.use)$() while holding $(item)$(k:key.sneak)$(). This will open the salad screen.
Up to five ingredients can be added in t: Up to five ingredients can be added in the top slots. $(thing)Bowls$() can be added in the left bottom slot. When you are done, the salad can be taken out from the right bottom slot.
$(thing)Wooden Buckets$() are an early g: $(thing)木桶$()是游戏早期的液体容器。它可以盛装任何可被用于合成的液体，例如$(l:mechanics/pot)锅$()或$(l:mechanics/barrels)大桶$()的某些配方中的所需的液体，最多 1000 mB。木桶不能放置水源方块，把木桶里的液体倒在地上只会出现少量的液体并很快消失。
The wooden bucket is made of $(thing)Lum: 木桶需要使用$(thing)木材$()制作。
$(thing)Physical Damage Types$() describ: $(thing)物理伤害的类型$()描述了玩家和生物可以造成的伤害的性质。一共有三种类型：$(thing)突刺伤害$()、$(thing)斩击伤害$()、和$(thing)打击伤害$()。有些生物对特定的伤害类型有抗性，因此部分武器对其效果不彰。
$(thing)Piercing$() damage is dealt by p: $(thing)突刺伤害$()是由尖利的武器（例如$(thing)刀$()）、投掷物（例如$(thing)箭$()和$(thing)标枪$()）、带尖牙的怪物（例如$(thing)蜘蛛$()）和$(l:the_world/flora#cacti)仙人掌$()造成的。$(thing)骷髅$()完全免疫突刺伤害，而$(thing)僵尸$()则对其抗性较低。
$(thing)Slashing$() damage is dealt by w: $(thing)斩击伤害$()是由具有长而锋利的边缘的武器造成的伤害，例如$(thing)斧头$()和$(thing)剑$()。这也包含大型$(l:the_world/wild_animals#predators)捕食者$()，例如熊和狮子等造成的伤害。$(thing)爬行者$()更容易受到斩击伤害。
$(thing)Crushing$() damage is dealt by b: $(thing)打击伤害$()是由钝器造成的伤害，例如$(thing)锤子$()和$(thing)狼牙棒$()。 $(thing)僵尸$()的攻击也造成打击伤害，并且它们对打击伤害有抗性。$(thing)爬行者$()也能抵御一部分打击伤害。$(thing)骷髅$()则更容易受到打击伤害。
$(l:mechanics/armor)Armor$() has its own: $(l:mechanics/armor)盔甲$()对不同伤害具有不同的防御力。一般来说，盔甲的质量越高，防御力整体越好，但同等级的盔甲仍可能稍有差异。比如在几种青铜盔甲中，$(thing)铋铜$()盔甲更擅长防御$(thing)打击伤害$()，$(thing)黑铜$()盔甲更擅长防御$(thing)突刺伤害$()，而传统的$(thing)青铜$()对任何伤害的防御都还不错。
For $(thing)Colored Steel$(), $(thing)Bl: 对于$(thing)彩钢$()来说，$(thing)蓝钢$()更擅长防御$(thing)打击伤害$()，而$(thing)红钢$()更擅长防御$(thing)突刺伤害$()。
$(thing)Armor$() provides protection aga: $(thing)盔甲$()可以抵御捕食者和怪物的攻击。制作盔甲所用$(thing)金属$()的等级越高，盔甲的质量也就越好。$(l:mechanics/leather_making)皮革$()盔甲是最弱的，而$(l:mechanics/steel)彩钢$()盔甲是最强的。
Leather armor is $(thing)Knapped$() from: 皮革盔甲是通过$(l:mechanics/leather_making)皮革塑形$()制成的。这种盔甲耐久度不高，但如果凑齐一整套，还是能提供少许防护的。
$(thing)Metal Armor$() requires multiple: $(thing)金属盔甲$()需要利用$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()经过多重步骤打造而成。首先需要将一个$(thing)双层薄板$()锻造成$(thing)未完成的$()盔甲部件。例外：靴子只需要一个$(thing)薄板$()。
Next, a $(thing)Sheet$() must be $(l:mec: 接下来，需要将一个$(thing)薄板$()$(l:mechanics/anvils#welding)焊接$()到部件上来完成制作。例外：胸甲需要一个$(thing)双层薄板$()才能完成。
Armor that is of the same tier but diffe: 同等级的不同金属制成的盔甲可能在耐久度和对不同$(l:mechanics/damage_types)伤害类型$()的防御上略有不同。三种不同的青铜中，$(thing)黑铜$()的耐久度最高、普通$(thing)青铜$()次之、$(thing)铋铜$()最弱。对于彩钢来说，$(thing)红钢$()的耐久比$(thing)蓝钢$()好一些。
Steel armor also provides benefits such: 钢制盔甲还有一些额外效果：例如$(thing)盔甲韧性$()和$(thing)击退抗性$()。普通$(thing)钢$()盔甲的盔甲韧性是1，$(thing)黑钢$()的是2，而$(thing)彩钢$()则有3点韧性。此外，$(thing)黑钢$()有 5% 的击退抗性，而$(thing)彩钢$()有 10%。
$(thing)Powderkegs$() are a device used: $(thing)火药桶$()是用来爆破的装置。它有12个只能放$(thing)火药$()的物品槽。爆炸的强度和内部火药的数量成正比。
Similar to the $(l:mechanics/barrels)Bar: 与$(l:mechanics/barrels)大桶$()类似，火药桶可以用$(item)$(k:key.use)$()键来密封和解除密封。只有密封的火药桶可以被点燃。
Explosions from powderkegs will cause ot: 引爆火药桶会导致其他火药桶也被点燃和爆炸。被爆炸破坏的所有方块都会以物品形式掉落，但是可能被炸到远处。
Powderkegs can be made from adding $(l:m: Powderkegs can be made from adding $(l:mechanics/dye)Red Dye$() and string to the crafting shape of a barrel.
Gunpowder can be made in two ways: the f: 有两种方式可以制造火药：第一种配方是用$(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#saltpeter)硝石$()、$(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#saltpeter)硫磺$()、和$(l:mechanics/charcoal_pit)木炭$()粉混合而成。粉末是在$(l:mechanics/quern)手推磨$()磨制对应矿物而成的。如果你有$(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#graphite)石墨$()，就可以使用第二钟更高效的合成配方。
The $(thing)Sluice$() is a device that i: The $(thing)Sluice$() is a device that is used to process $(thing)Ore Deposits$(), producing the same results that $(l:mechanics/panning)Panning$() does, with different probabilities.
The sluice is made from sticks and lumbe: 使用木棍和木材制作洗矿槽。
When placed, the sluice takes up two blo: 洗矿槽被放置后会占据两个方块。为了让它正常工作，水必须流过洗矿槽的顶部并从底部流出。如果水看起来流过了整个洗矿槽，就表示它在正常工作。流进洗矿槽的水必须是水流的最后一格水，且在洗矿槽的出口处必须有一个空方块让水能够流进去。
一个正确安装的洗矿槽。
To use the sluice, drop deposit items in: 要使用洗矿槽，只需要把矿石沉积物方块以物品形式丢到上游水流中，让水流把物品冲进洗矿槽，沉积物会出现在洗矿槽中。一段时间之后，洗矿的产物就有可能从下游吐出。
A working sluice with items inside of it: 一个正常工作的、里面有沉积物的洗矿槽。
Sluicing can give three possible product: Sluicing can give three possible products: $(thing)Ore$(), $(thing)Loose Rocks$(), and $(l:mechanics/gems)Gems$(). The probabilities are as follows:$(br)$(li)Ore: 55%%$(li)Loose Rock: 22.5%%$(li)Gem: 0.9%%$()Each rock type has a specific gem that it will drop, that is exclusive to that rock type.
There are a number of ways to produce li: 群峦传说中有很多不同的光源，比如$(l:mechanics/lamps)灯$()，但是点灯需要燃料。其他一些光源则只需要一个火花就能点亮。
Torches can be made by heating sticks or: 要制作火把，只需要用$(l:getting_started/firepit)篝火$()或其他热源来加热木棍或木棍堆。
Torches last for 3 days, and then become: 火把在$(thing)燃尽$()前可以燃烧 3 天。手持另一根火把或起火器并点击$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就能重新点燃燃尽的火把。
Candles last for 11 days, and may also b: 蜡烛可以燃烧 11 天, 并且同样可以重新点燃。
Candles can be made by sealing $(thing)S: 将$(thing)线$()封入装有$(thing)蜡脂$()的$(thing)大桶$()中凝固就能制成蜡烛。
Jack 'o Lanterns are the lit version of: 点亮$(thing)雕刻过的南瓜$()就可以将其变成南瓜灯，它可以持续发光 4.5 天，然后就会变回雕刻过的南瓜。
$(thing)Carved Pumpkins$() are made by c: 用$(thing)剪刀$()或$(thing)刀$()$(item)$(k:key.use)$()键点击新鲜的$(l:mechanics/crops#pumpkin)南瓜$()可以得到$(thing)雕刻过的南瓜$()。雕刻过的南瓜不会腐败，并且可以戴在头上。
$(thing)Panning$() is a method of obtain: $(thing)Panning$() is a method of obtaining small pieces of certain native ores by searching in rivers and other waterways.$(br2)Panning makes use of $(thing)Ore Deposits$() which are found in gravel patches in the bottom of lakes and rivers.$(br2)In order to get started panning, you will need an empty pan.
Clay can be $(l:getting_started/pottery): 粘土可以$(l:getting_started/pottery)塑形$()成淘金盘，如上图所示。
Once the pan has been $(thing)knapped$(): $(thing)塑形$()完成后别忘了$(l:mechanics/heating)烧制$()。$(br2)你找到的$(thing)沉积物$()可能包含几种不同的矿石：原生铜、原生银、原生金或锡石。
板岩地貌中的原生金沉积物。
Then you can begin panning!$(br2)$(bold): 接下来你就可以开始淘金啦！$(br2)$(bold)1. $()对着含矿沉积物$(thing)使用$()淘金盘。$(br2)$(bold)2. $()站在水中时，手持淘金盘按住$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就可以开始淘洗盘中的砂砾。$(br2)$(bold)3. $()一小段时间后，如果你足够走运，你就会获得一小块矿粒。
Panning can give three possible products: Panning can give three possible products: $(thing)Ore$(), $(thing)Loose Rocks$(), and $(l:mechanics/gems)Gems$(). The probabilities are as follows:$(br)$(li)Ore: 50%%$(li)Loose Rock: 25%%$(li)Gem: 1%%$()Each rock type has a specific gem that it will drop, that is exclusive to that rock type.
Heating items is a way of converting one: 将物品加热可以将其转化为另一种物品或熔化为液体。$(l:getting_started/firepit)篝火$()、$(l:getting_started/pit_kiln)坑窑$()或$(l:mechanics/charcoal_forge)木炭炉$()等设备都可以加热物品，它们的工作原理都大同小异。当将物品放入这些设备时，物品就会逐渐升温。物品的工具提示中会说明它当前的温度。
The $(thing)Charcoal Forge$() is a devic: $(thing)木炭炉$()是一种用于$(l:mechanics/heating)加热$()和熔化物品的设备。$(l:mechanics/crucible)坩埚$()也必须配合炉才能使用。木炭炉最大的作用是将物品加热到可以在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上锻造的温度。$(br)将 5 块$(thing)石头$()围绕一个 7 或 8 层的$(l:mechanics/charcoal_pit#charcoal_pile)木炭堆$()就能搭建成木炭炉了。
A complete forge multiblock, ready to be: 一个构建完成的木炭炉多方块结构，准备点燃。
A Forge needs a chimney in order to work: 木炭炉只能在通风良好的地方正常工作。木炭炉方块的正上方必须是空气或一口$(l:mechanics/crucible)坩埚$()。另外，木炭炉方块或它周围两格十字形的区域内（由右侧示意图中的蓝色染色玻璃标注）必须至少有一格$(thing)露天$()方块。$(br2)可以在木炭炉正上方一格的相邻位置放置一个$(l:mechanics/bellows)风箱$()来提高木炭炉的最大温度。
The five slots at the bottom of the forg: 木炭炉底部的五个空格用于放置燃料。木炭炉燃烧时会不时地消耗燃料。燃料可以是$(thing)木炭$()或$()其他自然$(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#bituminous_coal)煤炭$()。上面的五个空格用于放置需要加热的物品。左侧的指示器显示了木炭炉当前的温度。右侧的空格可放置可容纳液态金属的容器，例如$(thing)小缸$()和$(thing)模具$()。在熔炉中熔化的物品将自动注入这些容器。
The $(thing)Charcoal Pit$() is a way of: 搭建$(thing)木炭坑$()是一种烧制$(thing)木炭$()的方法。木炭坑是用$(thing)原木堆$()构成的。手持$(thing)原木$()时按住$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()并按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就能在地上放置一个原木堆。手持原木对准原木堆按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()，或直接打开原木堆界面就能放入更多原木。
Log piles need a solid block under them: 原木堆需要下方有一个实心块。它们很容易着火。
The charcoal pit is formed by surroundin: 木炭坑必须由实心、且不易燃的方块将原木堆密封而成。最终产出的木炭的量与原木堆内的原木数量成正比。要开始烧制木炭，在密封起来的木炭坑上挖一个小孔，点燃一个原木堆，然后迅速再把孔填上。当看到整个木炭坑中有$(thing)烟雾$()升起时就说明成功了。
The building of one possible charcoal pi: 分层展示如何搭建木炭坑。坑的具体大小是可变的。
After the charcoal pit burns out and sto: 等到木炭坑停止燃烧之后就可以把它挖开了。坑里面应该会留下许多$(thing)木炭堆$()。每个木炭堆最多包含 8 层$(thing)木炭$()，用铲子挖掘就可以获得木炭。挖出来的木炭也可以通过按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()重新放置下来。
A $(thing)Crucible$() is an advanced dev: $(thing)坩埚$()是一种用来制作$(l:mechanics/crucible#advanced_alloying)合金$()的高级设备。用坩埚制作合金比用$(l:getting_started/primitive_alloys)小缸$()更精确也更方便，$(br2)要制作坩埚，首先你得先获取一些比普通粘土更强的$(l:mechanics/fire_clay)耐火粘土$()。耐火粘土可以通过粘土塑形制作成$()未烧制的坩埚$()。
粘土塑形制作$(thing)未烧制的坩埚$()。
After the crucible is knapped, it will n: 塑形之后就可以用$(l:getting_started/pit_kiln)坑窑$()或$(l:mechanics/charcoal_forge)木炭炉$()之类的设备将坩埚$(thing)烧制$()成型了。$(br2)要使用坩埚，就得给它提供一个热源。任何位于坩埚下方的方块都可以作为其热源。$(l:mechanics/charcoal_forge)木炭炉$()就很合适。
现在你就可以使用坩埚了。与坩埚互动打开$(thing)坩埚界面$()，如右图所示。屏幕上方的区域显示的是坩埚内目前容纳的金属。其中第一行写的是如果现在从坩埚内取出将会得到的金属或合金的名称。其他条目则是现在坩埚内的剩余金属的种类和数量。
The crucible has nine slots where items: The crucible has nine slots where items can be added to be melted, and their liquefied contents will be directly added to the crucible. Molten metal containers such as $(l:getting_started/pottery#mold)Molds$() can also be placed here and they will be slowly drained into the crucible, allowing for precise control over your alloy's content. Holding $(item)$(k:key.sneak)$() while hovering over a draining mold or vessel makes it drain faster. $(br2)Molds or other fluid containers can also be placed in the output slot, and will be slowly filled with the current content of the crucible.
The temperature indicator on the left wi: 根据热源方块的温度变化，屏幕左侧的温度指示器也会相应上升或下降。只要温度足够熔化金属，就随时可将金属取出。$(br2)值得一提的是，破坏坩埚并不会销毁它的内容物。你可以用这种方法将合金转移到其他地方。
A $(thing)Bellows$() is a device which c: $(thing)风箱$()是一种可以增大气流以提升其他设备燃烧温度的方块。然而，燃烧的温度越高，消耗的燃料也就越多。风箱可以作用于它正对着的那一格方块，或是正对着一格的正下方一格方块。因此，$(l:getting_started/firepit)篝火$()和$(l:mechanics/charcoal_forge)木炭炉$()都可以从风箱受益。
To use the bellows, simply place it faci: 要拉动风箱，$(item)$(k:key.use)$()点击即可。在一段时间内，目标设备的最大燃烧温度会获得提升。
A $(thing)Grill$() is an item that can b: $(thing)烤架$()是一种可以用来升级篝火的物品。有烤架的篝火可以一次性烹饪五件物品，同时烧出的食物会获得$(thing)原木烤制$()词条，略微延长其$(l:mechanics/decay)保质期$()。手持$(thing)锻铁烤架$()对准$(l:getting_started/firepit)篝火$()按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就能将它放上去了。
The grill is created by working a $(thin: 烤架是通过在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上锻造$(thing)锻铁双层薄板$()制成的。$(br2)下一页展示了烤架界面。和篝火类似，它有四个燃料槽，必须在顶部空格中添加燃料。温度指示器也和篝火相同。唯一不同的是用于加热物品的槽的数量变成了五个。
A $(thing)Pot$() is an item that can be: $(thing)陶锅$()是一种可以用来升级篝火的物品。有陶锅的篝火可以用来制作特殊的餐点或实用的物品。$(br2)手持$(thing)陶锅$()对准$(l:getting_started/firepit)篝火$()按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就能将它放上去了。
It then must be $(l:mechanics/heating)fi: 然后它必须$(l:mechanics/heating)烧制$()成$(thing)陶锅$()才可以放在篝火上。
Like the firepit, the pot has four slots: 和普通篝火类似，陶锅有四个燃料槽，必须在顶部空格中添加燃料。温度指示器也和篝火相同。唯一不同的是它不再能直接加热物品了，取而代之的是五个用于放置食材的空格。陶锅还可容纳最多 $(thing)1000 mB$() 的液体。$(br2)要用锅炖汤，先必须手持任何类型的液体容器（如木桶）对准陶锅按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()。然后添加物品，点燃篝火。汤会沸腾一段时间，直到制作完成。
Soup is made from 3-5 $(thing)fruits$(),: 汤可以包含 3-5 个 $(thing)水果$()、$(thing)蔬菜$()或$(thing)肉类$()。汤炖好了之后锅里的水会变成红色。拿着$(thing)碗$()$(item)对着汤按下$(k:key.use)$()就能盛一碗出来。汤会将所有食材的营养元素组合成一顿餐点。
Other pot recipes transform the items an: 陶锅还可以将某些液体转化为其他液体。例如，在水中煮沸 5 份$(thing)草木灰$()可以制成$(thing)碱液$()。
Chisels are a tool for creating decorati: 凿子是一种用来将方块加工成它们的装饰版本（比如楼梯和台阶）的工具。$(thing)凿子$()必须配合任意材质的$(thing)锤$()一起使用。将锤置于副手的同时手持凿子就可以加工瞄准的方块了。
If you can chisel that block, a $(c)red: 如果一个方块可以被凿制，它的轮廓会根据你目前选择的$(thing)凿子模式$()变成$(c)红色$()。$(br2)凿子有三种模式：$(thing)台阶$()、$(thing)楼梯$()和$(thing)平滑$()。可以按下$(item)$(k:tfc.key.cycle_chisel_mode)$()来切换。凿子的模式指示器会显示在快捷栏旁边。
Press $(item)$(k:key.use)$() to convert: 对准方块按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就能将它加工成红色轮廓显示的样子。如果选择的是台阶模式，另一半台阶会以物品的形式掉落。凿成的方块朝向会根据你面朝的方向和准心所指的位置而改变。简而言之，凿成的方块的朝向会和你自己手持那个方块放置时的朝向相同。
The three chisel modes usable on a $(thi: 在$(thing)天然石灰岩$()上使用三种凿子模式（注意观察红色轮廓的位置）。
The chisel can also be used in some craf: 直接用凿子在合成栏合成以便批量制作方块。
Be careful! Chiseling in a mineshaft is: 当心！在矿井中直接凿成的方块依然受重力影响，而且你每次凿方块的时候，都有可能导致$(l:mechanics/support_beams)塌方$()。
In TerraFirmaCraft, raw rock is unstable: 群峦传说中，天然岩石并不稳定，有发生$(thing)塌方$()的危险。如果不加防范，$(thing)天然岩石$()、$(thing)矿石$()、$(thing)平滑岩石$()、和钟乳$(thing)石锥$()等方块都可能从天而降，把你砸成肉饼！$(br2)为了防止发生这等惨剧，你必须确保周围的方块都$(thing)受到支撑$()。
Collapses can occur whenever a player $(: 每次玩家挖掘任何$(thing)天然岩石$()时，若附近存在$(thing)未被支撑的$()天然岩石，就有可能发生塌方。一旦塌方开始，即便是已经$(thing)有支撑的$()岩石也可能开始塌方。$(br2)自然生成的洞穴顶部的岩石$(thing)自然承重$()，无需人工支撑。若天然岩石的正下方存在无法发生塌方的固体方块，那么这个方块也被算作是$(thing)被支撑的$()。此外，使用$(thing)支撑梁$()可以一次支撑一大片区域。
When graded $(l:the_world/ores_and_miner: When graded $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals)Ore$() (ore that can be poor, normal, or rich) collapses, it degrades in quality. Rich ore will become normal, normal will become poor, and poor will turn to cobblestone. Mineral ores will turn into cobblestone right away.
Dirt, grass, clay, gravel, cobblestone,: Dirt, grass, clay, gravel, cobblestone, and sand are also affected by gravity. However, unlike vanilla gravity blocks, these blocks fall down slopes, and cannot be stacked more than one high without supporting blocks around. $(l:mechanics/sluices)Ore Deposits$() also landslide, but do not degrade in quality.
To get started, $(thing)Support Beams$(): $(thing)支撑梁$()可以用$(thing)锯$()和任意类型的$(thing)原木$()合成。$(br2)在其他方块上放置$(thing)支撑梁$()就可以产生三格高的垂直支撑梁，在梁的下方必须有固体方块作为支撑。
$(thing)Horizontal$() beams can be place: 放置$(thing)水平$()支撑梁可以连接距离不超过 5 个方块的两个$(thing)垂直$()支撑梁（如上图所示）。
Only $(thing)Horizontal Support Beams$(): 只有$(thing)水平支撑梁$()才能起到$(thing)支撑$()效果，垂直的和转角的都不行。每一根水平支撑梁可以支撑以自身为中心，$(bold)9 x 5 x 9$()范围内的任何方块。$(br2)除了可以用支撑梁作为支撑，岩石下面的其他固体方块（例如其他有支撑的岩石）也会提供支撑。但是需要注意的是，$(thing)楼梯$()和$(thing)台阶$()等$(thing)非固体方块$()，以及$(thing)平滑岩石$()，是$(bold)无法$()提供支撑的。
Finally, it is important to know that $(: 最后注意，$(l:mechanics/chisel)凿制$()岩石和挖掘岩石一样可能导致塌方。$(br2)$(br2)北京第三区矿业委提醒您：矿道千万条，安全第一条。承重不规范，亲人两行泪！
You remembered where you picked up those: 你还记得你是在哪里捡到那些$(l:getting_started/finding_ores)小矿粒$()的，对吧？寻找更多矿石需要花费大量精力来勘探和开采。现在，你应该已经通读$(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals)矿石和矿物$()这一章节。你应该明白，如果你在寻找特定的矿石，则必须先找到它生成的岩石类型——不论是就在你家门口，或是千里之外。
When picking up small nuggets becomes un: 当仅靠捡拾小矿粒不能满足你的发展需要时就应考虑开始勘矿了。$(br)$(li)小矿粒只会生成在矿脉水平 15 格以内，垂直 35 格以内的地表上。当地表上有一片矿粒时，它们的几何中心的正下方很可能就有一支矿脉。$(li)有些时候，矿石也会暴露在断崖或水底，这种矿脉就很好发现了。
If you're looking for metal ores or mine: 如果你挖了好久都没有找到想找的矿石或矿物（顺便一提，只有矿石会在地表生成矿粒），那么就是时候做一把$(thing)勘矿镐$()了。勘矿镐会搜索点击的块中心 25x25x25 的区域，并报告所找到矿石的数量和类型。
To make a Prospector's Pick, you can $(l: 你可以用粘土按上图$(l:getting_started/pottery)塑形$()成一个未烧制的勘矿镐头模具。
Once the mold has been $(l:getting_start: 模具$(l:getting_started/pottery)塑形$()完之后还需要$(l:mechanics/heating)烧制$()。$(br2)将液态金属倒入到烧制好的模具中就能$(l:getting_started/finding_ores#casting)铸造$()出勘矿镐了。
A Prospector's Pick Head can also be $(l: 勘矿镐头也可以在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上使用任何可以制造工具的金属$(thing)锭$()$(l:mechanics/anvils#working)锻造$()而成。$(br2)最后用木棍和工具头在合成栏合成就能做出勘矿镐了。
The Prospector's Pick will never report: 勘矿镐说有矿就是有矿，它说没矿也有可能有矿，但如果没矿它绝不会说有矿。更高等级的工具会降低甚至完全消除误报的概率。$(br2)用同一等级的勘矿镐点击同一个方块不会改变报告的结果。$(br2)如果在勘探处的周围有多种矿物，勘矿镐只会选择其中一种报告。
Right-clicking a Prospector's Pick on a: 勘矿镐会报告以下几种结果之一：$(br)$(li)没发现什么有意思的。（可能是假阴性）$(li)发现微量$(li)发现少量$(li)发现中量$(li)发现大量$(li)发现巨量$(br2)发现巨量表明至少有 80 个方块。
The $(thing)Bloomery$() is a device used: The $(thing)Bloomery$() is a device used to smelt $(thing)Iron Ore$() into $(thing)Iron Blooms$() which can be worked into $(thing)Wrought Iron$(). The iron ores are $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#hematite)Hematite$(), $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#limonite)Limonite$(), and $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#magnetite)Magnetite$(). These ores melt into $(thing)Cast Iron$() rather than $(thing)Wrought Iron$(). All iron-bearing items melt into Cast Iron. To turn them into usable iron, the bloomery is needed. Any iron item can be used in the bloomery, including iron tools and cast iron ingots!
The bloomery is made from 8 $(thing)Bron: The bloomery is made from 8 $(thing)Bronze Double Sheets$().
A minimum size bloomery. The bloomery bl: 最基础的锻铁炉结构。锻铁炉方块可以用$(item)$(k:key.use)$()打开或关闭。
The bloomery can contain up to a maximum: The bloomery can contain up to a maximum of 48 $(thing)Inputs$(), with 16 items per layer of the chimney. To add layers to the chimney, stack up two more layers of stone blocks.$(br2)To add items to the bloomery, climb up to the top and throw items inside. A tower of grey ore should form.
将物品添加到锻铁炉中。
The bloomery consumes $(thing)2 Charcoal: The bloomery consumes $(thing)2 Charcoal$(), and $(thing)100 mB of Cast Iron$() to produce one $(thing)Bloom$(). After filling the bloomery with a combination of $(thing)Charcoal$() and $(thing)Ore$(), light the bloomery block, and wait 15 hours for the bloomery to smelt. When the bloomery shuts off, it leaves behind a $(thing)Bloom$() block. This contains $(thing)Raw Iron Blooms$() which can be obtained by mining the $(thing)Bloom$() repeatedly with a pickaxe.
The $(thing)Raw Iron Bloom$() must be wo: $(thing)生铁方坯$()还必须在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上打造成$(thing)精铁方坯$()。
The $(thing)Refined Iron Bloom$() must b: 在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上进一步打造$(thing)精铁方坯$()就能获得$(thing)锻铁锭$()了。
$(li)If the bloomery finds itself with m: $(li)如果投入锻铁炉的物品超出了它的所能处理的数量，它就会从锻铁炉门口吐出来。$()$(li)如果要取回投入锻铁炉中的物品，不要试图挖掘塔中的熔融物，直接把锻铁炉方块挖掉即可。$()$(li)方坯只会熔化成铸铁，而不是锻铁。方坯必须经过锤炼才能变成锻铁！$()
A $(thing)Blast Furnace$() is an advance: $(thing)高炉$()是一种用来炼$(thing)钢$()的高级设备。将$(thing)铁矿石$()、$(thing)木炭$()、和$(thing)助焊剂$()在高热环境中混合就能制造出一种比锻铁更强的金属。$(br2)要搭建高炉，你必须先制作两只$(l:mechanics/crucible)坩埚$()、一根锻铁$(thing)鼓风口$()、和一个风箱。此外，你还会需要很多$(thing)锻铁薄板$()和$(thing)耐火砖块$()。
Crafting a blast furnace itself requires: 制作高炉方块本体就需要一只$(thing)坩埚$()，以及八张$(thing)锻铁薄板$()。
You will then need to construct the blas: 接下来就可以开始搭建高炉的$(thing)烟囱$()了。烟囱必须用足以承受炼钢高温的$(l:mechanics/fire_clay#fire_bricks)耐火砖块$()搭建。耐火砖块的外层还需要用$(thing)锻铁薄板$()围绕一圈加固。如果材料富裕，也可以用更高级的金属薄板（如$(thing)钢$()）来代替锻铁薄板。
The blast furnace's chimney can be up to: 高炉的烟囱最多可以搭建 5 层，每层烟囱需要额外 4 块$(thing)耐火砖块$()和 12 张$(thing)锻铁薄板$()。每额外搭建一层烟囱，高炉就可以同时多烧炼 4 个物品，从而提升工作效率。
In order to use the blast furnace, you m: 必须从高炉的烟囱顶投入炼钢所需的素材。要炼钢，首先将等量的$(thing)铁矿石$()和$(l:mechanics/flux)助焊剂$()投入高炉。铁矿石可以用任何能被熔化成$(thing)铸铁$()的物品代替。另外，你还需要在高炉燃烧的过程中不断加入$(l:mechanics/charcoal_pit)木炭$()来维持燃烧。
Using the blast furnace will open the bl: 与高炉方块互动可以打开高炉界面，如右图所示。高炉界面会显示炉中的金属和燃料数量。屏幕右上角的空格必须放置一根$(thing)鼓风口$()。有了鼓风口高炉才能达到可以炼钢的温度。可以在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上锻造鼓风口。
You will also need a $(l:mechanics/bello: 要让高炉达到炼钢的温度，还需要在高炉方块的任意邻面放置一个$(l:mechanics/bellows)风箱$()。
A full size blast furnace with bellows a: 一个最大的完整高炉结构，包含风箱。
Finally, to get started, light the blast: 最后，用$(l:getting_started/firepit#firestarter)起火器$()或$(thing)打火石$()点燃高炉方块就可以开始炼钢了。高炉会缓慢加热矿石，同时要注意不断鼓风和添加木炭。当高炉内的温度足以熔化矿石时，矿石就会熔化并转化为$(l:mechanics/steel)生铁$()。
This liquid metal will drip into any met: 熔融生铁会从高炉中流入任何直接放置在其下方的容器（如$(l:mechanics/crucible)坩埚$()）中。之后可从坩埚界面将熔融生铁浇铸至铸锭模具中。你不能直接用生铁制作工具或装备，它还必须再经过一些其他工序处理之后才能使用。具体方法请参阅$(l:mechanics/steel)炼钢$()章节。
Steel is an advanced material which can: $(l:mechanics/blast_furnace)高炉$()烧炼出的$(thing)生铁$()并不能直接使用，必须先将其转化为$(thing)钢$()后才能进一步加工成工具或$(l:mechanics/armor)盔甲$()。根据生产工艺的不同，可以将生铁锻造成几种不同的钢：普通$(thing)钢$()、$(thing)黑钢$()、$(thing)红钢$()和$(thing)蓝钢$()。

$(thing)Black Steel$() is an advanced fo: 当你获得了一定数量的$(thing)钢$()后，就可以开始制作三种有色钢之一，$(thing)黑钢$()了。黑钢是三种高级有色钢合金中最基础的一种。要合成黑钢，首先得先在$(l:mechanics/crucible)坩埚$()中制作$(thing)脆钢$()。

$(thing)Blue Steel$() is one of the two: $(thing)蓝钢$()是群峦传说中最高级的两种合金之一。另一种是$(l:mechanics/steel#red_steel)红钢$()。烧炼蓝钢的第一步和烧炼$(l:mechanics/steel#black_steel)黑钢$()类似，要先在$(l:mechanics/crucible)坩埚$()中合成$(thing)脆蓝钢锭$()。
$(thing)Weak Blue Steel Ingots$() can be: 接着，将$(thing)脆蓝钢锭$()和$(thing)黑钢锭$()焊接在一起便能合成$(thing)高碳蓝钢锭$()。最后，将高碳蓝钢锭在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上锤炼成$(thing)蓝钢锭$()即可。

Anvils are an important tool required fo: 砧是开展冶金大业必不可少的工具。砧的主要作用是焊接金属锭，或将它们锻造成各种不同的工具和装备。$(br2)$(l:mechanics/anvils#working)锻造$()是指将一块金属锭打造成其他形状，以便于将其制成某些工具或装备的工艺。而$(l:mechanics/anvils#welding)焊接$()则是指将两块金属锭或其他金属部件粘连在一起物品的工艺。
Anvils can be crafted with $(thing)Doubl: 砧是由它们对应的金属$(thing)双锭$()制作的。在获得你的第一个砧前，你只能使用最原始的$(l:getting_started/primitive_anvils)石砧$()。有了石砧，你就可以用它来$(l:mechanics/anvils#welding)焊接$()出$(thing)铜双锭$()了。
Anvils each have a $(thing)Tier$(), whic: 砧是分$(thing)等级$()的。等级决定了什么样的金属和材料可以在这个砧上加工。只有等级和砧相同或比砧低的材料才可以在砧上锻造，而能在砧上焊接的金属的最大等级为砧的等级 +1。$(br)$(li)$(bold)第零级$()：石砧$(li)$(bold)第一级$()：铜$(li)$(bold)第二级$()：铋铜、黑铜、青铜$(li)$(bold)第三级$()：锻铁$(li)$(bold)第四级$()：钢$(li)$(bold)第五级$()：黑钢$(li)$(bold)第六级$()；红钢、蓝钢

You will then need to select the $(thing: 开工前，你必须先选择锻造$(thing)目标$()。$(item)$(k:key.attack)$()点击卷轴图标打开目标一览，选择完后会自动返回砧界面，且卷轴图标会转变为你刚刚选择的物品，同时屏幕上方的三个空格会显示当前目标所需的$(thing)锻造规则$()。

In the middle of the anvil screen, there: 屏幕的最中间有一根长条和一红一绿两个指针。$(2)绿色指针$()表示了目前的锻造进度。$(4)红色指针$()表示了锻造目标。你需要做的，就是将绿色指针与红色指针对齐。
$(2)Green$() actions will always move yo: $(br2)屏幕正中的$(4)红色$()与$(2)绿色$()按钮代表了不同的$(thing)锻造手法$()。使用$(2)绿色$()手法会将绿色指针向$(bold)右$()移动，而使用$(4)红色$()手法则会将绿色指针向$(bold)左$()移动。注意！如果你把绿色指针打出了屏幕，锻造素材就作废了！然而，单单将两个指针对齐是不够的。你还必须遵守额外的$(thing)锻造规则$()……
The $(thing)rules$(), are the two or thr: 每个目标都会有两到三个$(thing)锻造规则$()，标注在屏幕顶部。锻造规则要求你按照特定的顺序使用特定的锻造手法来完成目标。比如，如果一个锻造规则要求“$(2)弯曲 倒数第二$()”，则你将指针对齐前的倒数第二个手法必须是“$(2)弯曲$()”
Your last three actions are shown right: 锻造规则下方会显示你最后使用的三个锻造手法。被满足的锻造规则的轮廓会变为绿色。只有当所有锻造规则都被满足，且两个指针也对齐时才算锻造成功。$(br2)最后，别忘了留意锻造素材的$(l:mechanics/heating)温度$()。金属锭只有在温度足够高时（其工具提示会显示“可加工”）才可以用来锻造。锻造到一半的物品可以从砧上取出再加热，其锻造进度会保留。
Working can be tedious, and take many st: 锻造可不是件容易活儿。新手往往需要将素材来回敲打多次才能做好，而老手便能一气呵成。对于某些锻造目标（比如工具头）来说，如果能在几步内就做成，锻造出来的成品的$(thing)锻造评价$()会提升。用评价高的工具头做出来的工具会有一定的属性加成。
There are four tiers of forging bonus:$(: 有四种不同的锻造评价：$(li)粗糙$(li)合格$(li)精良$(li)完美！$(br2)根据工具类型的不同，这些词条会改变工具的耐久度、挖掘速度、和伤害等属性。

You also need to have at least one $(l:m: 将两件物品放在砧上（手持物品按住$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()的同时按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()，或打开界面手动放入都行）。砧上还必须至少有一份$(l:mechanics/flux)助焊剂$()。材料都放好后，手持任意$(thing)锤$()对准砧按住$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()的同时按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()。只要听见锤击的音效，且两件物品合二为一就说明完成了。焊接好的物品可以用空手从砧上取出。
The list of uses of fire clay is small,: 耐火粘土能做成的东西不多，但每个都是科技进步上不可或缺的要素！耐火粘土比普通粘土能承受更高的高温，因此某些高级设备只能用耐火粘土建造。
Fire clay is made from $(l:the_world/ore: Fire clay is made from $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#graphite)graphite$() powder, crushed in a $(l:mechanics/quern)quern$(), as well as $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#kaolinite)kaolinite$() powder

The $(l:mechanics/crucible)Crucible$() i: 用耐火粘土塑形成未烧制的$(l:mechanics/crucible)坩埚$()。
The $(l:mechanics/blast_furnace)Blast Fu: 作为理想的隔热材料，耐火砖是建造$(l:mechanics/blast_furnace)高炉$()的必需品。
$(thing)Fire Ingot Molds$() are a strong: $(thing)Fire Ingot Molds$() are a stronger type of $(l:getting_started/pottery#mold)Ingot Mold$() that has just a 1 in 100 chance of breaking, compared to 1 in 10 for a regular ingot mold.
The $(thing)Quern$() is a device for gri: The $(thing)Quern$() is a device for grinding items. It can make powders, $(l:mechanics/dye)dyes$(), and some other items. It is assembled from a $(thing)Base$() and $(thing)Handstone$().$(br2)The Quern can also be connected to a $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#quern)Mechanical Power$() network.

Point at the top of the quern block and: 对准手推磨底座的顶面按$(item)$(k:key.use)$()放上磨盘。

The quern is used to make various $(thin: 手推磨可以将各种矿物磨成$(thing)粉末$()，例如$(thing)硫磺$()。
$(l:mechanics/dye)Dye$() can be obtained: $(l:mechanics/dye)Dye$() can be obtained from various flowers.
$(thing)Gems$() can also be ground into: $(thing)Gems$() can also be ground into powder.
$(l:mechanics/flux)Flux$() is also obtai: $(l:mechanics/flux)助焊剂$()也可以用手推磨获得。
$(thing)Fishing$() is a way of hunting t: 河湖大海中的鱼必须通过$(thing)钓鱼$()才能抓住。若鱼竿上有鱼饵，鱼儿便会试图咬钩。咬钩的鱼儿有时会把鱼饵吃掉。鱼咬钩后还要收线才能钓上来。更高级的鱼钩收线时越容易操控。
First, you have to forge a fishing hook: 首先，你需要在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上锻造出一只鱼钩。

The fishing bar replaces the experience: 钓鱼时蓄力条会取代经验条。
Fertilizers are used to add nutrients to: Fertilizers are used to add nutrients to $(l:mechanics/crops)crops$(). $(item)$(k:key.use)$() with a fertilizer in your hand on some $(thing)Farmland$() or a $(thing)Crop$() to add the nutrients. Particles should appear, indicating the fertilizer was added.

The composter just requires some $(thing: The composter just requires some $(thing)Lumber$() and $(thing)Dirt$() to make!

Some $(4)brown$() items contribute littl: 有些$(4)棕色$()物品对堆肥桶贡献较小，例如干芦苇、蕨类、藤蔓、以及落叶。要满足堆肥桶对棕色物品的需求，你需要 16 个这类物品。
Some $(4)brown$() items contribute moder: 有些$(4)棕色$()物品对堆肥桶贡献中等，例如草木灰和黄麻。要满足堆肥桶对棕色物品的需求，你需要 8 个这类物品。
Some $(4)brown$() items contribute a gre: 有些$(4)棕色$()物品对堆肥桶贡献很大，例如西瓜、南瓜、枯萎的灌木、松果、以及浮木。要满足堆肥桶对棕色物品的需求，你需要 4 个这类物品。
Some items will $(c)poison$() your compo: 有些物品会$(c)污染$()你的堆肥桶。比如$(c)肉$()和$(c)骨头$()。用腐烂的堆肥施肥会立刻使农作物死亡。
Flux is a powder which is required for $: 助焊剂是$(l:mechanics/anvils#welding)焊接$()时的必需品，同时它也是$(l:mechanics/blast_furnace)高炉$()炼钢所必须的催化剂。助焊剂是在$(l:mechanics/quern)手推磨$()上制作的。$(br2)助焊剂最直接的获取方式是研磨$(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#borax)硼砂$()。

Using a bucket, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() on a lamp to add fuel to it. Lamps are smithed in the $(l:mechanics/a: Lamps are smithed in the $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvil$() and crafted with $(l:mechanics/glassworking_applications#lamp_glass)Lamp Glass$() to be completed.
One lamp fuel is $(thing)Olive Oil$(). T: $(thing)橄榄油$()就可以作为灯的燃料。要获得橄榄油，首先要制作橄榄糊。
Boil the $(thing)Olive Paste$() with $(t: 在$(l:mechanics/pot)锅$()里用$(thing)水$()煮$(thing)橄榄糊$()可以得到$(thing)毛橄榄油$(). 把它和$(thing)黄麻网$()一起密封在$(l:mechanics/barrels)大桶$()里可以得到$(thing)橄榄油$(). 每单位橄榄油的燃烧时间是 8 游戏内小时。
另一种较弱的燃料是$(thing)蜡脂$()。要制作蜡脂，在$(l:mechanics/pot)陶锅$()中用淡水中煮 5 份$(thing)鲸脂$()。每单位蜡脂的燃烧时间只有不到 2 游戏内小时。蜡脂可以用于制作$(l:mechanics/lighting#candles)蜡烛$()。
Lava will keep burning forever, but can: 熔岩灯是一种$(thing)永久光源$()。不过，只有$(l:mechanics/steel#blue_steel)蓝钢$()灯才能盛装熔岩。
$(thing)Chains$() are a great way to han: $(thing)链子$()可以用来挂灯，在$(l:mechanics/anvils)砧$()上就能锻造。
$(thing)Minecarts$() are a means of tran: $(thing)Minecarts$() are a means of transporting players, entities, and large blocks. Blocks that would normally $(l:getting_started/size_and_weight#overburdening)overburden$() the player can be transported in minecarts. $(l:mechanics/decay#large_vessels)Large Vessels$(), $(l:mechanics/barrels)Barrels$(), $(l:mechanics/powderkegs)Powderkegs$(), $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvils$(), and $(l:mechanics/crucible)Crucibles$() can be added to carts by pressing both $(item)$(k:key.use)$() and $(item)$(k:key.sneak)$(). Using $(item)$(k:key.sneak)$() with an empty hand removes the block. Crafting recipes for minecart items can either be done with $(thing)Iron$() or $(thing)Steel$(), with the steel-based recipes being more productive.
$(thing)Chest minecarts$() operate the s: $(thing)Chest minecarts$() operate the same as regular TFC chests, in that they only have 18 slots and cannot hold very large items like logs.
The $(thing)Barrel$() is a device that c: $(thing)大桶$()是一种可以容纳物品和液体的设备。大桶中央的空格是用来放置物品的，液体则显示在左侧的水槽中。将$(thing)桶$()或$(thing)罐$()放在左上角的空格中可以将其中的液体添加到大桶、或将大桶中的液体盛出。拿着容器对着装有液体的大桶按下$(item)$(k:key.use)$()也有同样的效果。
Barrels can be $(thing)Sealed$(). Sealin: 可以按屏幕右边的按钮来将大桶$(thing)密封$()。密封状态下的桶在被破坏时会保留其中的液体。部分配方必须在密封的大桶中才能制作。对着大桶空手$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$()$(item)$(k:key.use)$()也可以切换大桶的密封状态。
$(li)Barrels can be filled by clicking a: $(li)手持空的大桶点击水源方块可以盛装液体。$()$(li)启封的大桶会在雨中慢慢地装满水。$()$(li)大桶会接住上方融化的冰柱。$()$(li)密封大桶会弹出不在中心空格的物品。$()
Barrels are an important device used for: 大桶的主要作用是用来混合某些液体和物品。用大桶合成时，桶内的液体和物品的比例必须正确无误。某些配方还需要将大桶$(thing)密封$()一段时间才能执行。
If the contents of a barrel does not mat: 如果大桶中物品的比例和配方所需的不一致，多余的物品或液体就会被浪费。但如果执行的是$(thing)瞬时配方$()，则必须提供对应液体的足量物品才能进行。
$(bold)Limewater$() is made by adding $(: $(bold)石灰水$()是由$(l:mechanics/flux)助焊剂$()溶于$(thing)淡水$()制成的。每份$(l:mechanics/flux)助焊剂$()可转化 $(thing)500 mB$() 的$(thing)淡水$()。$(thing)石灰水$()可以用来加工$(l:mechanics/leather_making)皮革$()，还可以用来合成$(thing)砂浆$()。
$(bold)Tannin$() is an acidic fluid, mad: $(bold)鞣酸$()是一种将某些$(thing)原木$()的树皮溶于$(thing)淡水$()中制得的酸性溶液。$(thing)橡木$()、$(thing)白桦木$()、$(thing)栗木$()、$(thing)花旗松木$()、$(thing)山核桃木$()、$(thing)枫木$()和$(thing)红杉木$()都可以用来合成$(thing)鞣酸$()。
A couple barrel recipes operate by mixin: 某些大桶配方需要以一定比例混合两种液体。例如，以 9:1 的比例将$(thing)奶$()与$(thing)醋$()混合可以得到$(thing)醋奶$()；醋和$(thing)咸水$()以相同比例混合可以得到$(thing)卤水$()。这种配方只能通过先在大桶里装一种液体，然后把装有另一种液体的陶罐或桶放在左上角的液体添加格内来完成。
Barrels have the ability to cool $(l:mec: 大桶还可以用来快速$(l:mechanics/heating)冷却$()其他物品。把热的东西浸泡在一桶$(thing)淡水$()、$(thing)橄榄油$()或$(thing)咸水$()中就会很快冷却下来。
Barrels have the ability to $(l:mechanic: Barrels have the ability to $(l:mechanics/dye)Dye$() and $(l:mechanics/dye#lye)Bleach$() items. Most color-able things, like carpet, candles, and $(l:mechanics/advanced_building_materials#alabaster)Alabaster$() can be dyed by sealing them in a barrel of dye or bleached by sealing them in a barrel of lye. See the dye chapter for more information.
Barrels can preserve items in $(thing)Vi: 将食物封入装有$(thing)醋$()的大桶里有助于延长其保质期。将任意$(thing)水果$()密封在装有$(thing)酒精饮料$()的大桶中就能得到醋。有关于用醋保鲜的知识，请参看$(l:mechanics/decay#vinegar)食物保鲜$()页面。
Barrels placed against the side of a blo: Barrels placed against the side of a block work the same as vertical barrels, but have restrictions on placement. For example, they must have a $(thing)Barrel Rack$() added to them with $(item)$(k:key.use)$() in order to have another sideways barrel above them.
Sideways barrels show their sealed state: Sideways barrels show their sealed state using the $(thing)Tap$(). If the tap is sideways, it is sealed.
Unsealed sideways barrels automatically: Unsealed sideways barrels automatically drain their fluid into open barrels (and other fluid containers) placed below the tap. The block the tap extends into must be a free air block in order for fluid to be able to drain.
All 16 vanilla $(thing)Dye Colors$() can: All 16 vanilla $(thing)Dye Colors$() can be obtained as items. Most flowers and other colorful plants can be ground into dye using a $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$(). Powders of $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals)metal ores$() can be crafted directly into dye. $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#graphite)Graphite$(), $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#kaolinite)Kaolinite$(), $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#sylvite)Sylvite$(), $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#lapis_lazuli)Lapis$(), Coke, and Charcoal powder can be crafted into dye as well.
Dyes can also be made into fluids. A dye: Dyes can also be made into fluids. A dye item and 1000mB of $(item)Water$() boiled in a $(l:mechanics/pot)Pot$() produces the same amount of $(thing)Dye Fluid$(). Dye fluids are used in $(l:mechanics/barrels)Barrels$() to color items.
Dyeing items in a barrel is cheaper than: Dyeing items in a barrel is cheaper than using items, requiring only 25mB of dyed fluid.
Dye fluids can be used to finish $(item): Dye fluids can be used to finish $(item)Music Discs$().
Dye fluids can even dye leather as if it: Dye fluids can even dye leather as if it were crafted!
Five $(item)Wood Ash$() and 1000mB of $(: Five $(item)Wood Ash$() and 1000mB of $(item)Water$() boiled in a $(l:mechanics/pot)Pot$() produces lye. 25mB of Lye removes the color from a colored item.
$(li)$(item)Black Dye$() is used for $(l: $(li)$(item)Black Dye$() is used for $(l:mechanics/scribing_table)Scribing Tables$().$(li)$(item)Red Dye$() is used for $(l:mechanics/powderkegs)Powderkegs$(). $(li)Unfired $(l:mechanics/decay#small_vessels)Small Vessels$() and $(l:mechanics/decay#large_vessels)Large Vessels$() can be dyed$().
In TerraFirmaCraft, no food will last fo: 在群峦传说中，食物可不会在箱子里等你一辈子！随着时间的推移，食物会$(thing)过期$()，变得腐烂。吃腐烂的食物不会恢复任何饥饿度，并且有可能导致$(thing)饥饿$()或$(thing)中毒$()之类的负面效果!$(br2)幸运的是，你可以使用多种$(thing)保鲜$()手段来让你的食物储存得更久些。
When you hover over a piece of food, you: 把鼠标悬停在食物上就能看到食物的保质期。比如：$(br2)$(bold)$(2)保质期: 1000年 七月5日 5:30（约5天）$()$(br2)通过使用各种保鲜手段，可延长食物的保质期。
One of the easiest ways to preserve food: 把食物装入$(thing)缸$()中是保存食物最简单的方法之一。$(thing)大缸$()最多可以存储九组物品。$(thing)密封$()时，里面的物品将获得$(5)$(bold)储存$()词条。拥有储存词条的食物的保质期是平常的 2 倍。$(br2)$(thing)小缸$()最多可以存储四组物品，放入其中的食物也会获得$(5)$(bold)储存$()词条。
One other way to easily preserve certain: 另一种十分简单的食物保鲜方法是烹饪。$(thing)熟肉$()比生肉的储存时间要久。$(br2)注意，加热时使用的设备会影响食物的保质期。某些太热的设备，例如$(l:mechanics/charcoal_forge)木炭炉$()和$(l:mechanics/crucible)高炉$()$(bold)不适合$()用来烹饪食物。它们烤出来的食物的保质期会打折扣。
Instead, a $(l:getting_started/firepit)F: 相反，用$(l:getting_started/firepit)篝火$()或$(l:mechanics/grill)锻铁烤架$()做出来的食物会获得保质期加成。比如，用$(thing)篝火$()烤制的羊肉保质期会延长 33 %，而用$(thing)锻铁烤架$()烤制的则会延长 66 %！
$(thing)Salting$() is a way to make meat: $(thing)抹盐$()是一种能让肉类保存得更久的方法。将肉与$(thing)盐$()在合成格内合成就能把盐抹上去。只有生肉可以抹盐，但抹了盐的生肉依然可以烤制，不会失去该词条。
One way of getting salt is through $(l:m: $(l:mechanics/quern)研磨$()$(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#halite)石盐$()可以得到盐。石盐是一种矿物。
有时森林里会在地上自然生成盐。可以从地上把盐挖走，也可以用$(item)$(k:key.use)$()放回去。
$(thing)Vinegar Preservation$() is a way: $(thing)酸渍$()是一种用来保存水果、蔬菜和肉类的方法。$(br2)在装有 250 mB $(thing)酒精饮料$()的$(l:mechanics/barrels)大桶$()中封入一颗水果就能将其转化为$(thing)醋$()。酸渍前，必须先将食物在$(thing)卤水$()中$(thing)腌制$()。卤水是由 1 份$(thing)醋$()和 9 份$(thing)咸水$()在大桶中混合而成的。
Once food is pickled, it can be sealed i: 将腌制好的食物放在装有醋的大桶中并密封便能延长其保质期。每份食物必须要对应至少 125 mB 的醋。不过一旦启封大桶或将食物从中取出，延长的效果就会失效。
Food should be stored in either sealed l: 食物应储存在大缸或$(l:getting_started/pottery#vessel)小缸$()中。放置在箱子或其他容器中的食物会吸引$(thing)老鼠$()。老鼠可以打开容器并将其中的食物吃掉，不过如果它们在几分钟内没有找到可以吃的东西就会消失。当你打开被老鼠光顾过的容器时会看到“这个容器里传来一股恶臭”的提示信息。提示：如果你在不关闭容器界面的情况下启封再密封大缸就不会招引害虫。
One challenge when farming is keeping yo: 务农时的一大挑战便是如何保持土壤湿润。根据地区$(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)降雨量$()的多寡，土壤可能本身就会含有一些水分。然而，单靠降水对于种植某些水量需求大的作物来说可能还不够。
Then simply look at any $(thing)Farmland: 手持$(thing)锄$()对准$(thing)耕地$()或需要水分的$(thing)农作物$()即可查看其当前湿润度。该方块的湿润度会以 0% - 100% 之间的一个数值显示在屏幕上。$(br2)湿润度无法减少——除非移动到降雨量更少的区域。不过可以在耕地周围放置$(thing)水$()方块来提升。
Crops are a source of food and some othe: 农作物是食物和其他一些材料的来源。虽然每种作物都略有不同，但其实都大同小异。要种植农作物，你需要先找一些$(thing)种子$()，破坏$(l:the_world/wild_crops)野生作物$()可以就得到一点。$(br2)有了种子，你还需要一把$(thing)锄$()。种子也可以作为$(l:mechanics/fishing)鱼饵$()。
In addition to finding wild crops, seeds: In addition to finding wild crops, seeds can also be produced from existing crops. When a fully mature crop dies - either by weather, or leaving it to rot - it will go to seed, dropping more seeds that can be used to grow even more crops next season.
To get started, a $(thing)Stone Hoe$() c: To get started, a $(thing)Stone Hoe$() can be $(thing)knapped$() as seen above.
Once the hoe head is knapped, it can be: 用锄头和木棍制作锄。$(br2)锄和原版一样，$(item)$(k:key.use)$()点击泥土方块就能将它们变成$(thing)耕地$()。除此之外，它还可以用来将$(thing)缠根泥土$()转化为普通$(thing)泥土$()。
All crops need to be planted on farmland: All crops need to be planted on farmland in order to grow. Some crops have additional requirements such as being waterlogged or requiring a stick to grow on.$(br2)Crops do not need $(thing)nutrients$() to grow, but they certainly help. There are three nutrients: $(b)Nitrogen$(), $(6)Phosphorous$(), and $(d)Potassium$(). Each crop has a favorite nutrient.
Consuming its favorite nutrient causes a: Consuming its favorite nutrient causes a crop to grow faster, and improves the yield of the crop at harvest time. That means that crops that consumed more nutrients drop more food when broken! Consuming a nutrient also has the effect of replenishing the other nutrients around it a small amount.$(br2)The next several pages list all the crops present in TFC

Mechanical power is the art of making th: Mechanical power is the art of making things rotate or move, by harnessing the elemental power of either wind or water.$(br2)Practically, many devices can be hooked up to mechanical power networks either to automate their movement, or provide power for other functionality
In order to get started with harnessing: In order to get started with harnessing mechanical power, you will first need a $(thing)Source$() of power.$(br2)$(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#windmill)Windmills$() are a way of harnessing the wind. They can be built nearly everywhere with enough space.$(br2)$(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#water_wheel)Water Wheels$() are a slightly stronger power source, as they harness the current found in $(thing)Rivers$()
$(thing)Windmills$() are a way of harnes: $(thing)Windmills$() are a way of harnessing the power of the wind to rotate an $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#axle)Axle$(). They are large, and require a completely unobstructed area of 13 x 13 x 1 to be placed. In order to create one, you will first need an $(thing)Axle$(), and then you will need one or more $(thing)Windmill Blades$()
$(thing)Windmill Blades$() can be crafte: $(thing)Windmill Blades$() can be crafted from cloth. A single windmill can have up to five blades, and the more blades, the faster it will rotate.
In order to create a windmill, first pla: In order to create a windmill, first place an $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#axle)Axle$() in any horizontal orientation. Then, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() up to five $(thing)Windmill Blades$() on the axle to create the windmill. It will slowly start spinning.$(br2)The windmill may break if the axle is already connected to another source, or if there is not enough clear space.
$(thing)Water Wheels$() are a way of har: $(thing)Water Wheels$() are a way of harnessing the power of flowing water in $(3)Rivers$() in order to generate power. When placed optimally, they can rotate at some of the fastest possible speeds available.$(br2)A water wheel requires a 5 x 5 x 1 area of space to be placed. Note that the water wheel may break if there are any obstructions in the area around it,
or if the axle was already connected to: or if the axle was already connected to another source.$(br2)Water wheels can be crafted simply from lumber.
In order to place a $(thing)Water Wheel$: In order to place a $(thing)Water Wheel$(), simply attach it on the end of any $(thing)Axle$(). The axle should be one or two blocks above a source of flowing water, i.e. a river.$(br2)Water below the height of the axle, when flowing, will cause the wheel to speed up. Any water elsewhere, or stationary water below the axle will impede the wheel's movement and cause it to slow down or stop.
Axles are the bread and butter of a rota: Axles are the bread and butter of a rotational network, and are the block that transfers rotational power from one location to the other. They can be connected up to five blocks long, but any longer and they will break!
Axles can also be crafted $(thing)Encase: Axles can also be crafted $(thing)Encased$(). These can either be placed by themselves, or on top of existing axles.$(br2)However, in order to transfer power further, you will need a $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#gearbox)Gear Box$()
$(thing)Gear Boxes$() are a way of chang: $(thing)Gear Boxes$() are a way of changing the $(thing)Direction$() of rotational power by using $(l:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gear)Gears$(). They are also useful in order to connect long chains of $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#axle)Axles$() together without breaking.
In order to use a gearbox, its sides mus: In order to use a gearbox, its sides must be configured. $(item)$(k:key.use)$() while holding a $(thing)Hammer$() on any face of the gearbox to enable input/output through that face.$(br2)Note that due to their internal structure, gear boxes can only have faces enabled on two different axes of rotation at the same time.
A $(thing)Clutch$() is a way of controll: A $(thing)Clutch$() is a way of controlling a rotational network via $(c)Redstone$(). It is an $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#axle)Encased Axle$(), which disconnects when powered, allowing rotation to pass through only when unpowered.
An example of a $(thing)Clutch$() in use: An example of a $(thing)Clutch$() in use.
One device that can be connected to the: One device that can be connected to the mechanical network is a $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$(), simply by placing a vertical-facing axle above the Quern. While connected, the Quern cannot be turned manually, instead it will grind items automatically as the axle above rotates.$(br2)The Quern will grind faster if the axle above spins faster.
Another mechanical device is the $(thing: Another mechanical device is the $(thing)Trip Hammer$(). The Trip Hammer automatically performs smithing on an $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvil$(). The Trip Hammer needs a $(thing)Bladed Axle$() to work. The Bladed Axle works like a regular axle, but has a blade on it that is used to activate the hammer.
A setup for a trip hammer.
Place a trip hammer below the axle, and: Place a trip hammer below the axle, and $(item)$(k:key.use)$() to add a hammer to it. The hammer must be a metal hammer. Make sure the trip hammer is oriented such that the bladed axle will push the hammer handle down. The hammer will then hit an anvil placed in front of it. The trip hammer always records the $(thing)'Light Hit'$() action, and always moves the cursor closer towards the target, requiring no input from the player. If an ingot is not hot enough or the anvil is the incorrect tier, a deep metal banging sound will alert you.
A $(thing)Crankshaft$() is a way of turn: A $(thing)Crankshaft$() is a way of turning $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power)Rotational Power$() into $(thing)Moving-back-and-forth Power$(). This can be useful in order to power devices such as the $(l:mechanics/bellows)Bellows$(), or $(l:mechanics/pumps)Water Pumps$().$(br2)The $(thing)Crankshaft$() consists of two parts: the base, and the shaft. The base must be connected to an $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power#axle)Axle$(), and devices can be connected to the end of the shaft.
The base can be crafted from $(l:getting: The base can be crafted from $(l:getting_started/primitive_alloys#brass)Brass$(). Once a base is placed, a shaft can be added to it by using a $(thing)Steel Rod$() on the base. If there is an empty space to the side of the crankshaft, the rod will be placed.
The crankshaft can be connected to a $(l: The crankshaft can be connected to a $(l:mechanics/bellows)Bellows$() by placing one adjacent to the shaft. This will then push automatically every time the shaft extends then contracts. When connected to a crankshaft it cannot be operated manually.$(br2)The crankshaft can also be connected to a $(l:mechanics/pumps)Pump$(), which can be used to transport fluids.
$(thing)Steel Pumps$() and $(thing)Steel: $(thing)Steel Pumps$() and $(thing)Steel Pipes$() are blocks useful for transporting fluids, such as $(thing)Water$(), $(thing)Salt Water$(), and $(thing)Spring Water$(). They can also be used to move source blocks, and fill small enclosed areas. Unlike $(l:mechanics/aqueducts)Aqueducts$(), they can also be used to transport source blocks upwards.
The steel pipe can be crafted from, pred: The steel pipe can be crafted from, predictably, $(l:mechanics/steel)Steel$(), on an $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvil$(). A $(thing)Steel Pump$() can be crafted from some $(thing)Steel Pipes$(), and $(l:getting_started/primitive_alloys#brass)Brass Mechanisms$().
In order to operate the pump, you will a: In order to operate the pump, you will also need a $(l:mechanics/crankshaft)Crankshaft$(), and a source of $(l:mechanics/mechanical_power)Mechanical Power$():$(br)$(li)The pump must be connected on the $(bold)bottom$() to a pipe.
$(li)On the narrow side, the pump must b: $(li)On the narrow side, the pump must be adjacent to the business end of a $(l:mechanics/crankshaft)Crankshaft$().$(li)The pump can reach up to $(bold)16$() blocks. The end of the pipe must be $(bold)submerged$() in the target fluid, and adjacent to a source fluid block.$(li)If the crankshaft is active, fluid will be brought up and appear on the wide end of the $(thing)Pump$().$(li)The pump can fill an enclosed area up to $(bold)32$() blocks with source blocks.
